loans.name: Tansu

texts.en:
Tansu is married with two children.  One of her children is in school, and the other is too young.  To lighten her husband’s load and contribute to the household income, she earned some money making boxes for gold.  On her sister’s advice, she began selling Tupperware (kitchen appliances, storage boxes, etc.) At first she didn’t know what she was doing and didn’t make a lot of sales. When she began doing well at it, she decided to do this job. 

She sells to her friends in the neighborhood and is happy with the work.  With the loan from Maya, she’ll buy products to sell.  In the future, she wants to earn more to raise and educate her children well.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Tansu Hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi.  Çocuğunu biri okula gidiyor ,diğeri ise daha küçük.  Eşinin yükünü hafifletmek, ev ekonomisine katkı sağlamak için ,evinde altın kutuları yapıp ek gelir sağlıyor.  Kardeşinin önerisi ile Tupperware(mutfak gereçleri,saklama kapları v.s.) ile tanışıyor .  İlk başlarda nasıl olur diye düşünerek az ürün alıp satıyor.Satışları iyi gidince bu işi yapmaya karar veriyor.  Mahallede çevresine satış yapıyor.  İşinden memnun.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi  ile ürün alacak.  İleride daha çok kazanıp ,çocuklarını en güzel şekilde yetiştirip ,okutmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Juston

texts.en:
Juston is a businessman dealing in carpentry. He is 40 years old, married, and has children. He is applying for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to be able to buy more stock and materials for finishing his work in progress at the carpentry workshop. He started his business in the year 1993 in a rural setting, but has seen it grow from one level to another through his hard work. The business is located in Kyarika 2, Ndangaro parish Rubirizi district. His customers are schools, surrounding households, churches and their continued support and his tireless effort have helped his business to grow. 

He started this very business to be able to have a source of income and in the long run to able to look after his four children aged 10, 8, 5 and 3 years. They all attend school at the moment. His major challenges in the business are competition and lack of enough quality timber. He is, however, determined to grow through his hard work. He wants to educate all his children to a high education, so that they can have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy varnish, nails and timber to finish carpentry orders.

loans.name: Tixela Group 1

texts.es:
Ana

Ana is the second of three sisters, she was not raised by her father because her mother and father were separated. their economic situation was so difficult that forced her mother to travel with her children and work in the southern coast of Guatemala. Her mother had a lot of troubles to raise them, they always had many limitations.

After her mother came back from working for the southern coast, she enrolled them at school. She did not liked to study so she only studied to third grade of elementary education.

She weaves typical tissues, Ana will use her credit for buying raw materials and increasing the tissue production. Ana considers the credit as a great opportunity for increasing her production.

She has five children, four females and one male. The bigger of her females is already married, she studied to ninth grade, the second female obtained ninth grade, the third one is studying her sixth grade, the fourth is studying her third grade, and the boy is in her first grade of elementary education.

Ana is the leader of Tixela Group 1, the group is formed by twelve women, they are in between 22 and 56 years old, their primary business is textile, their second activity is general stores. On average they have four children. Their average loan amount is Q 3,500.
texts.en:
Ana is the second of three sisters, she was not raised by her father because her mother and father were separated. their economic situation was so difficult that forced her mother to travel with her children and work in the southern coast of Guatemala. Her mother had a lot of troubles to raise them, they always had many limitations.

After her mother came back from working for the southern coast, she enrolled them at school. She did not liked to study so she only studied to third grade of elementary education.

She weaves typical tissues, Ana will use her credit for buying raw materials and increasing the tissue production. Ana considers the credit as a great opportunity for increasing her production.

She has five children, four females and one male. The bigger of her females is already married, she studied to ninth grade, the second female obtained ninth grade, the third one is studying her sixth grade, the fourth is studying her third grade, and the boy is in her first grade of elementary education.

Ana is the leader of Tixela Group 1, the group is formed by twelve women, they are in between 22 and 56 years old, their primary business is textile, their second activity is general stores. On average they have four children. Their average loan amount is Q 3,500.

loans.use: to expand her tissue business

loans.name: Tixela Group 2

texts.en:
Martina

At the age of 9 years she began working with her father, she harvested coffee, it was a very hard work. She helped her father until she was 16 years old. At that age she married, she has been married for 24 years. She says that with her husband they continue working to make a good marriage.

She has one son with disability, it was diagnosed since he was born. Now he is twenty years old, Martina says he is clever, he can use a computer, watches TV, but he do not like to interact with others. He does not walk, uses a wheel chair and can use only half of his body. With her husband, and her other son they have the compromise of attending him.

Martina began her Tissue business when she was 23, she has been weaving since then; because of their financial needs she began a Cafeteria offering snacks, Martina will use her loan to expand her Cafeteria business, her expectations is that this activity will help her covering the expenses of her “special child”.

Martina is the leader of the group Tixela 2, the group is integrated by 8 women, their age are is between 20 and 40 years, and on average they have 4 children. Their principal activity is Textile. Their average loan amount is Q 4,350.

loans.use: to expand her cafeteria

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two go to school. She has no additional family members. She is a tailor. She operates her business from a shop that she rents. She operates on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works six days a week.

She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy materials for clothes. Her major business challenge includes seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy an electric sewing machine. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy materials for clothes.

loans.name: Chheurn

texts.en:
Chheurn, 44, is a married man from Kampong Speu Province. He has four children; one is a garment factory worker while other three are in school. He is a security guard with a daily earning of $ 5.00. So far, he has been in this career for three years.  His wife, Ngar, is a garment factory worker with a daily earning of $ 7.00. 

Recently, some parts of his house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, he has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for his house renovation. 

He and his family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for his house renovation

loans.name: Joves

texts.en:
Joves is 51 years old, married to Evalyne, and they are blessed with four children ages 24, 20, 18 and 15 years. He has been practicing rearing livestock for 20 years and earns KES 12,000 per month.

Joves has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, to buy a dairy cow that will boost his income from the supply of milk. He plans to use the profits to buy a plot, so as to increase growing food for his animals. He hopes to eradicate poverty and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow that will boost his income from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
From Laguna, Philippines, Rosalyn is a widow and has children. She is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Rosalyn works as a seamstress, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s dictates. She uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines as well as handstitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Rosalyn is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason Rosalyn is asking for your assistance to help her circumvent loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from her paycheck. She is seeking a 15,000 PHP loan to pay for her ATM card that was pawned.

Rosalyn hopes that their lives will become improve in the future. She looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force and equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Levita before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To redeem her pawned ATM card.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production, hence enabling her to sell different kinds of shoes to her clients and gain more income.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a hard-working married woman with four children, three of them attending school, in Kasese, Uganda. 

She trades in gonja (sweet bananas) to earn a living. She also runs a restaurant, plus doing farming, to get additional income. Harriet hasa dream of being the largest supplier of gonja in the area. 

However, limited capital is a challenge. Harriet wants money to buy sweet bananas, commonly known as gonja, to sell.

loans.use: to buy sweet bananas, commonly known as gonja, to sell.

loans.name: Dolice

texts.en:
Dolice is a sixty-year-old married woman with seven children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. 

She operates a retail shop that sells general merchandise. She started the business to get income to sustain her family and she hopes to expand her business though she is affected by inadequate capital. 

Dolice has asked for a loan to buy general merchandise like cooking oil and rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise like cooking oil and rice to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 38 years old. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Margie is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, sacks of feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

Margie has been in business for four years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, sacks of feed, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 41 years old. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Nelia is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nelia has been in this business for 13 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is a thirty-one-year old married man with five children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. 

He deals in cocoa buying and selling but also deals in motor cycle transport. He loves his business and works  hard to maintain it despite challenges of accidents due to the sharp corners on the road and the hills.  

He wants a loan to buy a new motorcycle for transport business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for  transport business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is aged 26 married with two children of ages ranging from 3 to 1 and ½ years and only one attends school in Hoima, Uganda. 

He deals in a retail shop, mainly buying and selling general merchandise, rice, sugar, and salt, among the items. He supplements his income by dealing in livestock. He intends to expand and pay school fees for his children. He will use the credit facility to buy more stock like salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a forty-one-year old married man with five children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. He rents cocoa gardens for a profit and this is  his major business. 

He works hard in his business but is affected by seasonality and inadequate capital. He wants a loan to hire cocoa gardens to harvest and sell.

loans.use: to rent cocoa gardens to harvest cocoa and sell.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, sigue trabajando en el campo y debido a la aproximación de la temporada de siembra requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas y también pagara el arrendamiento del terreno en el que cultivara granos básicos.
El resultado de la inversión del crédito anterior en su negocio ha sido positivo, su cosecha fue abundante, tiene más clientes satisfechos y su núcleo familiar vive en condiciones más dignas.
texts.en: Tomas continues to work as a farmer, and due to the nearing of the planting season he requires a new loan to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and he will also pay the lease of the land where he will cultivate the dry grains. The result of the previous loan on his business has been positive: his harvest was abundant, he had more satisfied customers, and his family lives in more dignified conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and also pay the lease of the land where he will cultivate the dry grains.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married woman who has no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Rachael operates a grocery stall selling vegetables.  She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. In addition, she also operates a cosmetic shop.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гулзат 40 лет, замужем, мать 4 дочерей. Гулзат в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 12 лет занимается разведением скота. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Гулзат имеет в хозяйстве 4 коровы, 25 овец. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме до 15,000 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Гулзат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Гулзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Gulzat is 40 and married with four daughters. She has been working raising livestock for 12 years as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work she currently has four cows and 25 sheep on her farm. The business as a whole brings in about 15,000 per month.

With the knowledge that her business is profitable, Gulzat has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase 10 sheep. She plans to put profits from the loan toward further improving her farm.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Zuchra

texts.ru: Зухра, 53 года, замужем,4  детей. У Зухры средне-специальное образование, она спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Зухра получает ежемесячную прибыль в размере до 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В наделе есть 2 коровы, на земельном участке ест теплица, где она выращивает картофель и огурцы. Зухра обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). На полученные средства она приобретет дойную корову для реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита накопит на ремонт дома
texts.en:
Zuchra is 53 and married with four children. She has a specialist high school education and is calm, balanced and hardworking. She receives a monthly income of about 15,000 KGS from her farm, which includes two cows and a plot of land with a greenhouse where she grows potatoes and cucumbers.

Zuchra has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase a dairy cow for sales of organic milk. She intends to put profits from the loan toward renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow to increase the volume of organic milk she can sell

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es:
José, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja en los  oficios domésticos y en una tienda; tiene una hija que está estudiando y vive en casa, también su mamá vive con él.

José, trabaja con ganado de repasto bovino, lo ha hecho por más de 2 años y lo aprendió de un amigo y también hace viajes con un pick up y cuenta con ayuda económica de un hermano.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, le mejorara mucho porque podrá tener más ganado y obtener más ingresos.

Sus sueños son, seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda, para poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia y que su hija se prepare académicamente.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old and studied up until the ninth grade. He has a partner, she is busy with domestic tasks and also works in a store. They have a daughter who is studying. As well as their daughter, José's Mom also lives with them. 


José makes a living with bovine livestock, he learnt the trade from a friend and he has been doing this for two years.  José also makes trips with his pick up and relies on financial help from his brother. 

José needs this loan to buy livestock, it would really help him as he could have more animals and thus increase his earnings. 

José's dream is to keep working as best he can, and to be able to offer a brighter future to his family and support his daughter to succeed academically.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Zuura

texts.ru: Зуура, 51 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Зууры- среднее образование, с 1990 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Зууры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 80 овец. На участке мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает кукурузу и рис. Экологически чистая и вкусная сельскохозяйственная продукция Зууры пользуется большим спросом, принося ежемесячный доход от 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зуура обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и подготовку земли для весенне-полевыых работ. В будущем Зуура сможет улучшить материальные и жилищные условия Зууры.
texts.en:
Zuura is 51 and married with three children. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture since 1990. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has 80 sheep on her farm as well as 1 hectare of land where she grows corn and rice. She gets a lot of demand for her delicious organic produce and has a monthly income of up to 25,000 KGS per month.

With the goal of further developing her business, Zuura has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase sheep and to prepare the land for the spring planting. In the future she will be able to improve her material and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep and to prepare the land for the spring planting

loans.name: Aag

texts.en:
Dynamic and influential in his community, Jean-Claude enjoyed good health until 1981, when epidemic conjunctivitis struck the community of Grison-Garde. Due to a lack of available health care, the conjunctivitis developed rapidly into blindness. Since then, he has been blind.

In 1999, following a broadcast of Dr. Pean, he decided to merge all the blind people in the community in an association to better support one another. On February 12, 1999, with the support of others in the civil society, Joseph founded the Association of Grison-Garde (AAG) of the Blind. Initially, 72 blind people had been identified and recorded; the association now has 54.

In 2007, thanks to a donation of about $1,100 US from the NGO German Agro Action, AAG has established an agricultural shop. Today, AAG would like to strengthen its business by purchasing 740 pots of peanut seeds.

The members of the association can be identified in the picture from the left to right as: Denis, Marisia, Gilbert, Jean-Claude, René, and Marguerite.

loans.use: to buy 740 pots of peanut seeds to promote the availability of seeds in the resort, especially for people with disabilities.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia is 49 years old with three children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Sesilia has requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2011, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Renat

texts.en:
Renat is a master craftsman and 29 years old. He is married with two children. The family is living in the Fuzuli region but for 22 years already they have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land, Fuzuli city. 

It’s noted that Renat is a master craftsman. He makes wooden doors and windows. And now he needs a loan amount of 1350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy material which is needed in his work. He is greatly thankful to Kiva organization for aid. 

In the future Renat wants to employ an assistant and to increase business.

loans.use: to buy material to increase business

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is single with five children and none of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She has a restaurant. She operates her business on retail basis and works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last three years. She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more foodstuffs like bunches of green bananas, flour, cassava and rice. Her major business challenges include transportation, seasonality and thieves. 

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, flour, cassava and rice.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna is a young and charming lady, 27 years old, who lives in Stepanavan city of Lori region. She is married and she has a son. Her husband is furniture maker. Syuzanna graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute. Her pedagogical experience is still very short, only 2 years, but she really likes her occupation and her work with children. Now she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian History. Also, at her house she gives paid private courses, during which she helps the pupils get ready for coming school exams, and some she helps with their homework. Syuzanna mentions that she finds it very important for any pupil to have the knowledge of history- the history of his nation. 

She asks for this loan, because she wants to buy a computer. She hopes that through it she can make her courses more instructive and colorful, it will help her pupils to concentrate with attention and interest on her subject.

loans.use: to buy a computer that she hopes can help her make her courses more instructive and colorful for her pupils.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 32 years old and married to Dennis. They are blessed with four children aged 13, 10, 8 and 4 years old. She sells maize, a business she has done for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES. 8,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production. Through the income earned, she will add more stock of maize to sell to her increasing number of clients in the market.

She plans to use the gained profits to repay the loan, and the remaining cash to open up a posho mill.

She hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production, and to enable her to sell more maize to her increasing number of clients in the market.

loans.name: Sirasi

texts.en:
Sirasi is a forty-year-old married man with eight children, of whom seven go to school. They are living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in the general store business for twelve years, working six days a week and twelve hours a day.  He also does farming for additional income. 

Sirasi hopes to educate his children at higher institutions of learning despite the challenge of limited capital. Sirasi is a hardworking man who intends to use the loan to buy plates, glasses, cups, and saucepans to sell.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, cups, and saucepans to sell.

loans.name: Arakel

texts.en:
Arakel is 32 years old and he lives with his family in Stepanavan city of Lori region. He is married and he has two pretty daughters. His wife and his mother are housewives. Here Arakel is very famous, because despite his young age he is already a skilled tiler, and he also constructs house interiors. Being the only breadwinner in his family, Arakel started working when he was a young boy. Now he is already known as a master of his work. His work is very attractive, clean and high quality. That is why he is a perfectly recommended master. 

 Arakel will be happy to have this loan, because for his work he must buy a new laser leveling machine and also an electric tile-cutting machine. He says thanks beforehand and he is sure that these purchases will make him more orders.

loans.use: to buy a new laser leveling machine and also an electric tile-cutting machine.

loans.name: Heric Hernany

texts.es:
Heric, está pasando por una dificultad económica, debido a que su esposa ha enfermado y los medicamentos son muy caros, por lo que está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar elotes, pollo, condimentos, tomates, azúcar, etc., para elaborar la venta de elotes locos, atoles y tamales, de esta manera ira cubriendo las necesidades de su hogar y otros gastos de salud de su esposa.
Con el préstamo anterior ha mantenido la continuidad de su negocio y las nuevas ganancias le han sido de ayuda para cubrir necesidades de su hogar y costear los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Heric is going through a difficult time financially because his wife has fallen ill and her medication is very expensive. This is why he is applying for a new loan to buy corn, chicken, condiments, tomatoes, sugar, etc. to make and sell elotes locos (crazy corn), atoles (a cornflour drink) and tamales so that he can cover the household bills and his wife's other medical costs.

With his previous loan Heric was able to maintain the upkeep of his business and his increased earnings helped him to cover the household bills and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, condiments, tomatoes, sugar, etc. to make and sell elotes locos (crazy corn), atoles (a cornflour drink) and tamales

loans.name: Maria Maximina

texts.es:
María, se dedica a vender helados (paletas, gelatinas y choco frutas), productos de primera necesidad y comercializa cerdos, vive con su esposo y una hija de nueve años, junto a su familia lucha para subsistir, no tienen ayuda económica del extranjero. El oficio lo aprendió con la ayuda de una prima, lo tiene instalado en su vivienda de esta manera realiza actividades domésticas y genera ingresos para cubrir gastos familiares.
Necesita de un crédito que invertirá en un cerdo para aumentar la porqueriza así mismo comprar paletas, sorbete, pasta de chocolate y frutas para elaborar su venta, pretende tener mercadería para que sus clientes estén satisfechos y espera que las ventas incrementen junto con sus ingresos.
El objetivo que tiene María es seguir trabajando para ayudar con los gastos de su familia y poder adquirir experiencia en el uso de créditos.
texts.en:
María makes a living selling ice cream (popsicles, fruit jellies and choco-fruits), staple goods, and pigs. She lives with her husband and 9-year-old daughter. She struggles alongside her family to survive; they have no financial aid from abroad. She learned her craft with the help of a cousin. Her business is installed in her home and this way she can carry out her domestic activities and generate income to cover the family's expenses. 

She needs a loan to invest in a pig to increase her livestock. She will also purchase popsicles, sorbets, chocolate pastes, and fruit to sell. She plans to have merchandise so that her customers are satisfied, and expects the sales to increase along with her income. 

María's objective is to keep working to help with the expenses of her family and to gain experience with loans.

loans.use: to invest in a pig so she can increase her livestock. She will also purchase popsicles, sorbets, chocolate paste, and fruits to sell

loans.name: Latif

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Latif. Latif lives in Solo, a city located about 6 hours drive from Jakarta. He owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories and provides mobile payment services for his community. 

He has already been part of Ruma for almost a year. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn more about expanding business through technology. His community sees him as a trustworthy mobile provider.

As the business grows, Latif is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Latif improves his business and accordingly, his community, who needs access to such services.  

Latif’s goal with Ruma in the nearly future is to provide e-commerce business for his costumers. As seen in the photo, Latif is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with two children and they both go to school. She has no additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes. She operates her business on a retail basis and moves door to door selling used clothes six days a week. She has been in this business for the last four years.

She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenge includes seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to get a permanent business premises. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

She operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT–SACCO to buy pineapples, watermelons, oranges, tomatoes, onions, passion fruit, and cabbages. 

Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. 

Her goal and aspiration is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages, watermelons, oranges, and passion fruit

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is very thankful for her first Kiva loan and hopes for the second profitable deal with lenders. She lives in the small, frontier city Ijevan of Tavush region. Susanna is unemployed now, and with her family members fully engaged in farming and agriculture. She sells her farm products such as milk, meat and eggs to her villagers; also her land goods, such as potatoes, beans greens, and tomatoes. Also from her large fruit garden, she gathers very tasty and nice fruits, such as apples, persimmons, figs etc. This time her farm cattle have a lack of fodder and she really hopes that Kiva will support her.

With this loan she wants to buy a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle, and also to buy chickens to develop her poultry.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for her cattle, and also to buy chickens to develop her poultry.

loans.name: Hayrapet

texts.en:
Hayrapet lives now in Kapan city of Syunik region. Now he lives alone since his two sons are married and both of them with their families live abroad. 

Hayrapet mentions that after the death of his beloved wife, he became fully engaged in farming, leaving his work at the city’s factory. In a nearby village he takes care of his rabbits and chickens and manages to sell the meat of rabbits and poultry and also eggs. 

His plot of land is not a small one on which he cultivates potato, beans, onions and also fruits such as apples and peaches. All these he sells locally to his neighbors and villagers. 

This loan he hopes to receive as he wants to buy 20 more chickens, fodder for his chickens, and also potato seedlings for spring sowing.

loans.use: to buy 20 more chickens, fodder for his chickens, and also potato seedlings for spring sowing

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a thirty-year-old married man and father of three children from Kasese Uganda. 

He sells maize flour in order to earn a living. 

Jackson has a dream of expanding his business and buying a motor vehicle to transport his maize flour into the markets. 

Jackson is requesting a loan to buy Maize flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize flour for selling

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a thirty-seven-year old hardworking woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

She deals in cattle fattening as her main source of income, although she also practices farming. 

She has been able to sustain her family from those businesses. 

Bad weather changes are her main challenge; however, she hopes to have an improved and modernized farm.

She is requesting for a loan to buy more cows for her farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for her farm

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick used his previous loan to buy fertilizers for his farm. He is a married man and lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

To support his family he has continued to grow bananas, but also sells other produce such as coffee on the side to supplement his income. 

His challenges as a farmer are those of inadequate capital and bad weather. 

He hopes to become a more modernized farmer.

He is requesting for a loan to buy fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Zhiydebubu

texts.ru: Жийдебубу, 52 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. Образование-среднее. Жийдебубу на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Жийдебубу имеет практический опыт в животноводстве и полеводстве, а также знает теорию по разведению скота в домашних условиях. Благодаря своей трепетной работе и ответственности, Жийдебубу на сегодняшний день имеет хорошее хозяйство: 2 коровы, 1 лошадь, 37 овец, а также обрабатывает 2,0 ГА поливной земли, на которой она ежегодно сажает фасоль. Ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жийдебубу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и 10 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en:
Zhiydebubu is 52 and married with two children. She has a high school education and has been working in agriculture and animal husbandry for 20 years. She has practical experience in both spheres and is also knowledgeable about the theory of raising livestock in household conditions. Thanks to her hard work and responsibility, she currently has a good-sized farm: two cows, one horse, 37 sheep and 2 hectares of land where she grows an annual harvest of beans. Her family's monthly income is 10,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Zhiydebubu has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase two cows and 10 sheep. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy two cows and 10 sheep in order to increase her herd

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He trades in produce and also practices farming to earn additional income. 

He hopes to expand into a modern farmer and educate his children. 

His vision is limited by inadequate capital.

He is requesting for a loan to buy more produce especially bags of maize, coffee, and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce, especially bags of maize, coffee, and beans to sell

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge Uganda. 

He operates a milling machine to earn income to support his family.  He also earns extra income from farming. 

He hopes to develop his business to wholesale, increase his level of income, and become a rich businessman. 

He faces a challenge of inadequate capital.

He is requesting for a loan to buy bags of dry cassava, maize, millet, and sorghum for milling to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy bags of dry cassava, maize, millet, and sorghum for milling to boost his business

loans.name: Sinak

texts.en: A mother of one child living in Kratie province, Sinak is 25 years old. To improve her family’s living, she grows rice and cassava. Moreover, she raises pigs to earn extra income. This is her first time with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy piglets and pig feed to support her business. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve and make her house more comfortable, and to support her child to study until graduating.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed to support her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been working in the coffee industry since 2006. He started out working for other companies, but in 2011 he secured his own washing station and has been running it successfully for three years. His coffee company is located in Nyamasheke District in the far south west of Rwanda on the border with the Congo and on the shores of beautiful Lake Kivu.

Joseph is a consistent and quality supplier to the Rwandan Trading Company, which exports his coffee to European and American markets. 

He needs financing to purchase a new water tank and some new drying tables. With this support, he expects to double his revenue and add 20 new jobs when he expands his business.

This is one of AEC's many loans in the coffee industry. All are paying back on time.

loans.use: To pay for a new water tank and new drying tables to increase capacity at his coffee washing station.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es: AZUCENA: Es una señora amable de 47 años de edad, madre soltera de 3 adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde hace 14 años estableció su pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda, de esta manera es el sustento económico de su familia. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar mercadería: granos básicos, sopas instantáneas, chiverías, embutidos, jabón de lavar ropa, de baño, de lavar traste, entre otros productos, para mejor su nivel de ingresos y calidad de vida. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa y establecer una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Azucena is a kind, 47-year-old woman, a single mother of 3 adolescents who are in school.  With the purpose of providing for her children, 14 years ago she established a small grocery store in the roofed open-sided veranda that runs the length of a side of her house. This is how the family is supported.

This requested loan is to buy merchandise:  basic grains, instant soups, snacks, cold meats, laundry soap, bathroom soap, and dish soap among other products in order to improve her level of income and her quality of life.  Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman and to set up a general store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: basic grains, instant soups, snacks, cold meats, laundry soap, bathroom soap, dish soap among other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow so as to increase his income from the sale of milk.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 37 years old, married to Evans, and blessed with five children aged 10, 8, 6, 4 and 2 years old. She has been in the business of supplying doughnuts to her customers for the last five years, and earns a monthly income of KES. 9,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable her purchase more stock such as wheat flour, cooking oil and cooking sufuria to increase the number of doughnuts produced and supplied per day to her customers.
 
She plans to use gained profits to repay the loan, and the remaining cash to buy a motorcycle for supplying doughnuts to her customers. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and educate her children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old. She is married to Francis and blessed with four children. Mary runs a salon business, as well as money transfer, which she has done for five years now, earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000.

Mary has requested for her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES. 100,000 which she will be using to add float for the money transfer, as well as purchase stock for her salon (including hair relaxers, extensions, shampoo as well as new towels). She successfully repaid her previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, Mary will be able to educate her children and renovate the business premises. 

Her hope and dream for the future is to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to add float for the money transfer as well as purchase stock for her salon

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 27 years old and is blessed with two children aged 5 and 3. 

She has been a tailor for the last 4 years, and earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES. She also does dairy farming.

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from Visionfund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production.  The income from the milk production will enable her to add inventory of cloth to make more dresses for her increased number of clients. 

She plans to use the generated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her future hopes are to be financially stable and open up a tailoring shop.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and get milk to sell

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin is 36 years old, married to Sibia, and blessed with three children aged 12, 8 and 5. She has been in the  retail business for the last 5 years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production.  The profits from the milk production will enable her to add more inventory to her retail shop. 

Her plans are to use the gained profits to repay the loan and the remaining cash to expand her business.
 
Her hopes are to be financially stable and meet her cutomers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 33 years old, married, and has four children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Annet sells fresh foods such as matooke, tomatoes and others. 

Out of the profits from the previous loan, she managed to expand her general store business and her life has become much better. 

She is looking forward to buying land and building a residential house to settle her family. 

Annet is still faced with the challenges of market competition and inadequate skills in terms of record keeping. 

Annet wants money to buy land for her family and live her dream.

loans.use: to buy land for her family and live her dream

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders, meet Erick, young, honest, humble and a very hardworking person. He hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Erick is still young and has so much that he wants to achieve before hitting 40; that is why he is focused and dreaming of being successful. 

Erick never got the chance to go to college because of a lack of money, but this never killed the zeal that he had for succeeding, and he started farming five years ago on a small plot of farmland given to him by his parents. Through hard work he has managed to practice crop farming and animal farming, and has managed to take care of his parents and also take care of his basic needs. Erick grows vegetables, fruits, and keeps dairy cows as a source of income. 

Although Erick has been making profits, he is challenged by timely delivery of products to the market. This has made his profits go down, because goods reach the market when they are not fresh and hence fetch lower prices. Erick comes from an area that has poor roads and this has been a major problem for him. That is why he is seeking a loan of 65,000 KES to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, Erick will be able to transport his farm produce to the market and deliver it in a timely manner, and hence it will fetch higher prices. Vegetables, fruits and milk are perishable products and they require quick delivery to the market, so this motorbike will be of so much help. Through timely delivery of his product, Erick is sure of increased profits and this will translate to better living conditions and a secure future. 

Erick is very ambitious and he is planning that once he has accumulated some profits, he will be able to go back to school. Through education he will be able to have a more secure future, because education is “the key to success.”

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Deogratias

texts.en:
Deogratias is a hardworking man who does farming and grows maize for both sale and home consumption. 

He begun the business to sustain his family and educate his offspring. 

Deogratias usually complains of pesticides and weather vagaries that affect his business returns. 

He wants a loan for ploughing, weeding, and buying pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.use: for ploughing, weeding, and buying pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard used his previous loan to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell. 

He is a 37-year-old, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

Price fluctuation, competition, and unpredictable weather changes still hinder his business, while his business plan is to own a food store.  

He is requesting a loan to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a twenty-seven-year old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge Uganda. 

He practices agricultural produce and that is how he earns a living. 

He also earns extra income from coffee planting. 

He was inspired by the need to cater for his family. 

He hopes to own a big store in the future, but is challenged by high rental costs.

He is requesting for a loan to buy bags of coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags of coffee to sell

loans.name: Elvia Nohemi

texts.es:
Elvia, de 32 años de edad, está estudiando primer año de bachillerato los fines de semana, el resto de la semana se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar, hace tortillas, hamacas y manteles para vender; está acompañada desde los 15 años de edad y su pareja trabaja en el aeropuerto, mejorando la pista de aterrizaje, tiene dos hijos, ambos están estudiando el nivel básico.

Elvia, vende tortillas todos los días, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 19 años, también trabaja en la elaboración de hamacas, este trabajo se lo enseño su madre y lo realiza desde hace 9 años, vende hamacas en su comunidad y por encargo.- Además, hace manteles para vender.

Elvia, está solicitando un crédito para comprar maíz, para poder seguir con su negocio de venta de tortilla y también para comprar material para la elaboración de hamacas, como hilo de seda y de poli seda, de esta manera espera poder seguir con su negocios y generando ingresos económicos en su hogar para lo que necesiten ella y sus hijos.

El sueño de Elvia, es hacer su casa, terminar sus estudios para poder conseguir un mejor empleo y además quiere comprar una plancha más grande para hacer tortillas.
texts.en:
Elvia, 32 years old, is studying her first year of high school on the weekends.  The rest of the week she sees to the household chores and she makes tortillas, hammocks and tablecloths to sell.  She has been married since she was 15 years old and her husband works at the airport doing runway improvement.  She has two children who are both in middle school.

Elvia sells tortillas every day.  She has had this business for 19 years.  She also works making hammocks.  Her mother taught her this work and she has done it for 9 years.  She sells hammocks in her community and to order.  Also, she makes tablecloths to sell. 

Elvia is requesting a loan to buy corn to be able to continue with her business selling tortillas and also to buy materials for making hammocks, like silk and polyester thread.  In this way she hopes to be able to continue with her businesses and generate income in her home to meet her and her children's needs.

Elvia’s dream is to build her house and finish her studies to be able to obtain a better job.  She also wants to buy a larger grill for making tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn and to buy silk and polyester thread for making hammocks.

loans.name: Alfan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Alfan. Alfan lives in Surabaya, a city in East Java located about two hours from Jakarta by plane. Alfan owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services for his community.  He has already been with Ruma for almost a year. He learned of Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wanted to try another business opportunity, as well as contribute more to his community. Alfan is a hard worker person and his community sees him as a trusted mobile provider.
 
As the business grows, Alfan is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payments to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Alfan improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services.  Alfan’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to add more services for his community, if the income capital is good enough to start another business.  As seen in the photo, Alfan  is the one who is standing in his own stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of his local community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 40-year-old father who lives in the Kapsowar area, which is located in the Rift Valley province of Kenya.

Benjamin is an ambitious man, and looks to a future when he is the leading supplier of horticulture products. He's working 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill his dream. 

He has farmed for five years, and earns an honest and decent income. 

Benjamin has both vegetables and a dairy farm, and has a small business to make ends meet. Although he has been making profits, life has not been easy for Benjamin. However, he has managed to overcome every challenge he faces. 

Benjamin seeks a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to venture into horticulture farming. His location is favorable to other types of farming due to the good road network, climate, and market demand. 

Benjamin and his family will work very hard to take good care of their investment in horticulture, in which they put their hopes for a better life. 

Benjamin is disciplined regarding finances, and he plans to enter international markets to earn more income, and obtain a stable future for his family.

loans.use: to venture into other areas of farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, the profits from which will be put toward opening a motorcycle repair shop.

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia, forty, is married and has four children aged eighteen, sixteen, fourteen and twelve; all of them attend school at the moment. The family lives in Ishaka town cell C, Bushenyi District.

Lukia has had a beauty salon since 2005. She opened it with the purpose of having a steady source of income and paying school fees for her children. She works ten hours a day and six days a week. Her clients are students and women who have helped her business to prosper. The high rent she pays for her shop is a major challenge, but she is determined to grow her business through honesty and hard work.

Lukia has applied for a loan of 4,000,000 UGX through UGAFODE to buy more hair gel, relaxers, braids, etc. for her business. She hopes these will boost her salon sales, generate a good amount of money and help her complete her house, which is still under construction. She appreciates the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy hair gels, relaxers, extensions, weaves, etc. for her shop

loans.name: Naftal

texts.en:
Naftal is 38 years old, married to Rebbecca, and blessed with four children. He has been a small scale farmer for the last 10 years and he earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from Visionfund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production.  The profits from the milk production will increase his overall income and enable him to buy farm inputs to increase his farm produce and earn a living from it. 

He plans to use the generated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His future hopes are to be financially stable and be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Angel payed his first loan on time and now is asking for a second loan to continue refurbishing his food stall and buy some cooking equipment.
texts.en: Angel paid his first loan on time and is now asking for a second loan to continue refurbishing his food stall and buy some cooking equipment.

loans.use: to buy an awning for his food stall.

loans.name: Elxan

texts.en: Elxan is 46 years old, married and has a child. His son is learning at the university. In the future, he wants to be a mathematics teacher. He has a store where he sells different foods. They are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land of Fuzuli city and now live in Fuzuli region. Today Elxan wants to support his business and therefore he has applied to Komak company for a loan of 1,100 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy goods (salt, butter oil, sugar etc.) to sell. He says he is thankful to the Kiva organization for the help. In the future, Elxan wants to build a new store and help his son with his education.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell and increase his business. In the future, he wants to build a new store and help his son with his education.

loans.name: Baloglan

texts.en:
Baloglan is married, has three children, and lives with his family in Fuzuli region.  His family have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) for 22 years. They have an animal breeding business, where he buys little calves, raises them, and sells them in a bazaar to earn money. 

Today, Baloglan needs a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat) to develop and increase the family business. With this loan, Baloglan wants to buy calves. This is Baloglan's second loan.  He paid the first loan in time. 

Baloglan is thankful for this loan from the Komak company, the Kiva organization and its lenders. 

In the future, to increase his business Baloglan wants to buy more cows.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both go to school. She has no additional members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting charcoal from the village to the market for sale. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and use her profits to buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón, de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado en la escuela de la comunidad, creció con sus padres, se casó cuando tenía 19 años de edad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también a tejer hamacas; es padre de dos hijos, uno de 17 y el otro de 15 años de edad, quienes actualmente están estudiando. 

Ramón, trabaja en la elaboración de hamacas, este oficio se lo enseñaron sus padres, su esposa y sus hijos le ayudan en este trabajo.- Aparte de la elaboración de hamacas, también se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y frijoles, a veces también trabaja cortando mescal, trabajos en los q no tiene horarios establecidos.

El crédito que Ramón, solicita es para comprar materiales como seda y poli-seda para la elaboración de hamacas, también comprará 4 cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos para tener un nuevo ingreso económico para su hogar.

El sueño de Ramón, es poder seguir creciendo en sus negocios, para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Ramon is 54 years old and studied until the 6th grade at a community school.  He grew up with his parents and got married when he was 19.  His wife is a housekeeper and also weaves hammocks.  He has 2 sons who are 17 and 15 and presently studying.  

Ramon works in hammock production, a trade that he learned from his parents.  His wife and his sons help him out with the business.  Besides making hammocks, he also makes a living farming corn and beans.  Sometimes he also works cutting mescal.  None of these jobs have an established schedule.  

Ramon is applying for a loan to buy materials to make hammocks such as silk and poly-silk, and he will also buy 4 pigs to fatten and sell later in order to have a new source of income for his household.  

Ramon's dream is to be able to continue growing his businesses in order to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials to make hammocks such as silk and poly-silk and to buy 4 pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынара, 53 года, в разводе, есть 2 детей. Чынара в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, благодаря упорному труду Чынары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы 2 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и воспитание детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Chynara is 53 and divorced with two children. She works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family and, thanks to her hard work, currently has four cows and two sheep on her farm, with a monthly income of up to 20,000 KGS, an amount that is insufficient to cover living expenses for herself and her family.

With the goal of further developing her business, Chynara has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase cows for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock and into improving her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy cows to help increase her income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase her earnings from the supply of milk

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es:
Alejandra es una mujer de 20 años, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 6 años y otro de 7 meses, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos por catálogo.
Ella es buena madre,  emprendedora, dulce, cariñosa, sensible, sincera, Inteligente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘el torno’ ubicado a 32 kilómetros de la ciudad, se caracteriza por su topografía cubierta por vegetación tropical,  Posee una gran riqueza forestal y diversidad de fauna silvestre. Es el lugar de reunión  de comerciantes de variedad de productos del campo. Su principal actividad económica es la agropecuaria, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el die entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Alejandra es de tez morena, estatura media, cabello castaño largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por el comercio (de pie, la segunda de la derecha, viste solera celeste con flores blancas y sostiene un bebé). Su vida la realiza al lado de su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos, el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor es un bebé de 7, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos por ampliar su negocio la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; 
Servicio de transporte, venta de pollo frito, venta de vajillas, tienda de barrio, venta de celulares, venta de carne de llama, venta de flores y taller de costura, para solicitar un préstamo y continuar con sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de las marcas; cyzone, esika, l’bel, y otros.., que realiza de forma ambulante a clientes casuales y otros constantes. Los productos más vendidos son; perfumes, lápiz labial, cremas anti edad, aretes, mascara para pestañas, tratamientos faciales, etc. “inicie esta actividad por la necesidad de trabajar y cuidar a mi hijo al mismo tiempo, es un negocio dónde uno se da el tiempo que puede para trabajar…” comenta. Su sueño es abrir una distribuidora de cosméticos y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de un stock de cosméticos por mayor, para ofertar variedad y aumentar sus ventas. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Alejandra solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para ofertar mayor variedad y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de su bebe recién nacido.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 20 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children aged 6 years and 7 months old. Alejandra makes a living selling catalogue cosmetics.
She is a good mother, hard-working, caring, intelligent and responsible. 

Alejandra works in a region called 'El Turno', located 32 kilometers outside of the city. This region is known for it's tropical vegetation, rich forests and wildlife. It's a place where local merchants of the region come together. The main economic activity here is farming. The climate is humid and tropical, with a temperature between 21-35 degrees celsius. 

Alejandra is brown-skinned, medium height, with long brown hair. Her maternal language is Guaraní, she also speaks Spanish for her work (in the picture Alejandra is standing, second from the right, holding a baby).

Alejandra's husband makes a living in construction. Her older child studies and the younger one is just a baby. They live in a rented house made from brick and cement with running water, electricity and sewerage. 

Her wishes for growing her business saw her create an institution with people running businesses such as: fried chicken, crockery, corner shop, cell-phones, llama-meat, flower-seller, clothes-repairs. The institution works together to get a loan and continue with their commercial activities. 

Alejandra's business is the sale of brand cosmetics, she does this on foot and with regular and casual customers. She started this work because of the need to work and look after her son at the same time. 

Her dream is to open a distribution store and invest in wholesale cosmetics, to be able to offer more variety and increase sales. This is the second loan for the institution in the year that they have been working together. Part of the loan goes to Alejandra to buy cosmetics wholesale in order to offer greater variety and use the benefits to pay for the costs of her newborn.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale in order to offer greater variety and use the benefits to pay for the costs of a new born.

loans.name: Sharifah

texts.en:
Sharifah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 2 years. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She would like to increase her inventory levels to attract more customers.

She lives in a rented house with access to electricity, but no access to piped water. 

Her major expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable him to get income to open a motorcyle repair shop.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 29 years old, married to Evans and blessed with two children aged six and three years old. She has been in the cloth selling business for the last seven years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,800.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable her to get income to add more stock to her business.

Her plans are to use the gained profits to repay the loan and the remaining cash to open a boutique shop.

Her hopes are to meet her dreams in life of opening a boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable her to get income to add more stock to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar and milk and make more profits to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable him to get income to buy more cattle to sell and make more profit.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 51 years old, married to Jane, and they are blessed with 4 children aged 10, 8, 6, and 3. Evans has been in the farming business for the last five years and earns 12,000 KES per month.

William has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to supply him with more milk to sell to to his clients and earn more income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to buy more cows for milk production.

He hopes to grow his business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Unión Trabajo Y Desarrollo  (Rocafuerte) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Unión Trabajo y Desarrollo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Rocafuerte, lugar  conocido por la gran variedad de dulces que se preparan en este lugar y que son reconocidos  a nivel nacional por su delicioso sabor. Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás  y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos han mejorado  sus pequeños negocios y su vida. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora María, tiene 47 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos mayores de edad, uno de los hijos aun vive con ella. El marido es agricultor.
Doña María es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, hace ya 10 años atrás arreglo un local en su casa en la cual instalo un pequeño bazar, allí ella vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y productos de Yanbal,  Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), cosas para regalos entre otros productos, ella trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 y mantiene su negocio abierto hasta las 21h00, lo cual no le incomoda ya que es un negocio que no le quita mayor tiempo y puede estar atenta a su hogar y ganarse lo suyo al mismo tiempo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, artículos para regalos, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y todo lo que ella vende. Lleva más de 3 ciclos en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ha aumentado su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un bazar mucho mas surtido.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Unión, Trabajo Y Desarrollo” (Unity, Work, and Development) meets every 15 days in the canton of Rocafuerto. This place is known for the wide variety of sweets that are prepared there and known nationally for their delicious flavor. The members of this group decided to join together some time ago and form this Communal Bank since it will help them obtains loans that will improve their small businesses and their lives. They engage in different business activities such as agriculture, general trade, services, and other trades.

One of the members of this group is Sra. María. She is 47 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has six grown children. One child still lives with her. Her husband is a farmer.

Doña María is a housewife who generates her own income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. Ten years ago, she renovated a space in her house so that she could open a small bazaar. María sells clothing of all types, shoes, Yanbal products, Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories), gift items, and other products. She works every day from 8:00 A.M. and stays open until 9:00 P.M. This is not an inconvenience for her since she is there most of the time and is able to take care of her home and earn an income at the same time.

María’s loan will be used to buy clothes, shoes, gift items, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and anything else that she can sell. She has been with her Communal Bank for more than three loan cycles and enjoys being a member because the loans have helped to increase her business. Her dreams include have more inventory for her bazaar.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, gift items, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and anything else that she can sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary used her previous loan to buy crates of soda and beer to sell. She is a thirty-two-year-old single woman with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She still owns a bar as her main source of income and practices farming as her side income. It is from these businesses that she has been able to sustain herself and her children as a loving mother. High rental and license fees are still a problem, but has hopes of expanding her business into a big alcohol depot.

Mary is requesting for a loan to buy crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Passy

texts.en: Passy is a 41 year-old single mother of two children living in Kasese, Uganda.  She decided to venture into selling second hand clothes in order to raise money to pay school fees for her children. With the proceeds she has been able to educate her children in good schools and build a house for her residence. Ever changing customer preferences and market competition are her biggest challenges. Her desire is to own a modern boutique and educating her children. Passy intends to use the loan to buy second hand skirts, dresses and blouses to resell.

loans.use: to buy second hand skirts, dresses and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is a 50 year-old married man, from the village of Bandza. He lives with his wife, pensioner mother and 2 children. To take care of his family’s everyday needs, Mamuka is engaged in cattle breeding. His wife helps him greatly in making their precious family's living and covering their increasing needs, especially their children's education. They produce cheese and yogurt and sell milk products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. 
As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Mamuka wants to expand his agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of his family. A loan of 2000 GEL will be a great support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling him to purchase 10 hives of bees and start beekeeping. Mamuka will sell honey at a good price and will generate additional income. Mamuka and his wife rely on the goodwill of the lenders and greatly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To start beekeeping and expand his agribusiness

loans.name: Edgar Adalberto

texts.es:
Edgar, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura cultivando granos básicos, trabajando como mozo con otros agricultores, heredo este oficio de sus padres y lo ha desarrollado toda su vida, además ofrece en sus ratos libres el servicio de motorista, actividad que desempeña desde hace 20 años, Edgar vive con su esposa y sus hijos, su familia trabaja junto a él para tener una vida más confortable.
Requiere de capital para pagar los costos de la recolección de la cosecha y contratar mozos para preparar el terreno para la próxima siembra, espera llevar a cabo sus actividades en el tiempo justo para obtener mejores ingresos y así estabilizar su economía familiar.
Sus sueños son incluir nuevos cultivos para fortalecer su negocio, cancelar su deuda y darle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Edgar works in agriculture, cultivating basic grains and working as an assistant to other farmers. He inherited this trade from his parents and has developed it his entire life. In his free time, he offers his services as bike driver, something he has done for 20 years. Edgar lives with his wife and children; his family works with him to have a more comfortable lifestyle.

He requests the loan to pay off the cost of crop harvesting and hiring farm-hand labor to prepare the ground for the next sowing season. He hopes to complete his activities on time, to obtain better profits and thus stabilize his family finances. His dream is to include new crops to strengthen his business, pay off his debt and give his family a better future.

loans.use: pay off the cost of crop harvesting and hiring farm-hand labor to prepare the ground for the next sowing season

loans.name: Misael Andino

texts.es:
Misael, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, creció con sus padres, quienes han trabajado en la agricultura y en la siembra de hortalizas, está soltero y vive con sus padres a quienes apoya económicamente.

Misael, trabaja en la agricultura, también trabaja con ganado y sembrando hortalizas, no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido.

El crédito que está solicitando es para hacerles algunas reparaciones a la vivienda de sus padres, ya que no se encuentra en buenas condiciones y teme que les suceda algún accidente a sus padres.- Además, invertirá $700.00 para comprar dos novillas, valoradas en $350.00 cada una, con lo cual quiere iniciar en el trabajo propio en la ganadería.

El sueño de Misael, es poder seguir con sus trabajos generando los ingresos necesarios, para poder tener una familia y darle lo que necesiten.- Además, quiere trabajar en las hortalizas, pues en la comunidad hay bastantes nacimientos de agua.
texts.en:
Misael, 22, studied until high school and grew up in the care of his parents who have worked in farming and planting orchards.  He is single and lives with his parents who he supports economically.  

Misael makes a living in farming and also works with livestock and planting orchards.  He doesn't have a fixed work schedule.
