He is applying for a loan to make some repairs to his parents' home, since it's in bad shape and he is afraid that they will have some kind of accident.  Additionally, he will invest $700 of the loan in 2 heifers, each valued at $350, which he wants to use to start his own livestock business.  

Misael's dream is to be able to continue working and making enough money, and to be able to have a family and give them what they need.  He also wants to work in orchards, since there are lots of water sources in the community where he lives.

loans.use: to buy two heifers, each valued at $350, and make some repairs to his parents' home

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is 23 years old and he is an accountant assistant. He needs a loan to buy a computer that he will use at his home. Omar would like to open his own business in the future. He is single and lives with his parents but they can't help him with money. It is Omar who supports his parents so he hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Rebeca is in her mid-50's, widowed, and has five children who are in school. For the past 15 years, she has been running a food stall where she works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily to earn a minimal monthly profit. 

This is Rebeca's 12th loan from Tujijenge. She used the previous loans to install a bathroom. She plans to use this loan to improve her food stall and install electricity. She hopes this loan will help increase her profits so she can continue to pay her children's school fees and pay for household expenses. 

Rebeca will share this loan with her loan group, Momela, which consists of 2 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To improve her food stall business

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married and has six children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member.  

Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.  She resides in the family house and has access to electricity, but no access to piped water. 

She has a business of selling fresh fish. She works in the market six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy fresh fish. 

She is aspiring to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 43-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. Josephine is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a charcoal making business in the Philippines. Josephine has requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy coconut shell, fire woods, etc. to use in her business.

Josephine has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy coconut shell, fire woods, etc. to use in her business.

loans.name: Rosene

texts.en:
Rosene is 54 years old, married, and has six children. Rosene works very hard to provide for her children.

Rosene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned good, noodles, shampoo, detergent, soap, soft-drinks, etc.

Rosene has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned good, noodles, shampoo, detergent, soap, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Jose Marvin

texts.es:
José, con el financiamiento anterior mantiene sus trabajos agrícolas con vida, cuenta que hoy tiene una porqueriza más equipada y ha podido almacenar una mayor cantidad de granos básicos para alimentar  a su familia.
Se decidió por un nuevo crédito para invertir en la compra de una vaca parida, de esta manera podrá producir lácteos para el consumo familiar y para vender, su objetivo es tener nuevos ingresos.
texts.en:
With the previous loan, Jose was able to keep going with his farm work and he mentions that today he has a better equipped pigpen and has been able to store a larger quantity of basic grains to feed his family.  

He decided to take out another loan to buy a calved cow to produce milk for personal consumption and sales, so that he can have a new source of income.

loans.use: to buy a calved cow to produce milk for personal consumption and sales

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en: Marie Louise is 37 years old. She is married with three children aged 8 to 17 years old. All of them go to school. She has a bar and has been in a business for the past 17 years.She is requesting a school fees loan in order for her to be able to pay the whole sum of money at once because she can only afford to pay it in installments. In her future,she wishes improve her standards of living from the profits.

loans.use: To pay school costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy silk thread to make hammocks and pay back the money that a neighbor lent her a few days ago to pay for her child's treatment

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is an old client of the institution from the Ishaka Branch. He is married with four children, three of whom are in school at the moment. His major source of income is farming, in particular in tea growing since 2006 in KakonI, Kyamuhunga, Igara, Bushenyi District. His clients are the tea factories and tea traders. He started farming to be able to have a steady source of income to cater for his family. He is a very hardworking man and has seen his business grow steadily from 2009 to date. In addition to tea farming, he also has a banana plantation where he earns additional money to supplement his income. His major challenges are price fluctuations and lack of enough capital, but he hopes to be sorted after getting the loan money. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 (One million five hundred thousand shillings only) to buy fertilizers and mulches for his tea plantation so that he can harvest much more than the usual quantities.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Cansu Türk

texts.en:
Cansu is married with one child.  To contribute to the household she began selling Tupperware (kitchen appliances, storage boxes, etc) on a friend’s advice.  She began by selling to her friends and neighbors a year ago.  At first she didn't make a lot of sales, but gradually they increased. She says because her child is young, she couldn't work outside the home, but this way she can make sales from home and earn an income.  She’ll use the loan from Maya to buy products wholesale and increase her sales.  She wants to raise her children in a comfortable financial position.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Cansu Hanım evli ,bir çocuk annesi.  Evine katkı sağlamak için bir arkadaşının önerisi ile tupperware (mutfak gereçleri,saklama kapları v.s.)satmaya karar veriyor.  Bir seneye yakın çevresine ,komşularına satış yaparak işe başlıyor.  İlk başlarda az olan satışları gittikçe çoğalıyor.  Çocuğu küçük olduğundan dışarıda çalışamayacağını ama bu şekilde evden satış yapıp evine katkı sağladığını söylüyor.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile toplu sipariş verip satışlarını arttıracak.  Çocuğunu en iyi şekilde yetiştirip maddi olarak rahat etmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Mercedes Cecilia

texts.es:
Mercedes, es casada, vive con su familia, desempeña el papel de ama de casa y también atiende una venta de ropa usada ubicada en la calle principal del mercado, el oficio lo desempeñaba junto a su familia, posteriormente decidió trabajar de manera independiente, ya cuenta con 15 años de tener su negocio.
Comprará fardos de ropa usada, ofrecerá mayor cantidad de estilos, tallas y colores de prendas de vestir, al realizar esta inversión espera que sus ventas sean mayores y contar con mejores ganancias.
Sus sueños son comprar una casa para vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia y resarcir sus deudas.
texts.en:
Mercedes is married, and she lives with her family. She performs household chores and also sells used clothing on the main street of the market. She used to carry out this work with her family but later decided to work independently. She has now had her business for 15 years. 

She is requesting a loan to buy bales of used clothing so that she can offer a greater variety of styles, sizes, and colors. After making this investment, she hopes to increase her sales and to earn a higher income. She dreams of buying a house so that she can live with her family in better conditions and of canceling her debts.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing so that she can offer a greater variety of styles, sizes, and colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a Solar Home Solution (solar panel, light and battery) to Increase her income & productivity

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace varios años a la siembra de maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los insumos agrícolas y el pago de arrendamiento de tierra para sus cultivos y asi seguir con sus trabajos para tener una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
The young man whose face is pixelated is 26 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He has been planting corn for several years. His products are sold at different markets that are near his house. The borrower lives in his own home along with his life companion and their two daughters.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies and pay the rent on the land where he grows his crops. As a result, he can continue his work so that he can achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay the rent on the land used for his crops.

loans.name: Rafael Amilcar

texts.es:
Rafael, por la facilidad de pago y buena atención que recibe de Padecomsm opta por solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar un nuevo freezer, para incrementar la producción de hielo de su negocio, espera continuar trabajando y mantener un buen record crediticio.
Con el capital anterior ha podido cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y tener mejores ganancias que le han servido para cubrir las necesidades familiares y compro una computadora e impresor para que su hijo pueda estar al día con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rafael decided to apply for a new loan from PADECOMSM because of the ease of payment and the amount of attention that be receives from them.  He will use the loan to buy a new freezer so that he can increase ice production for his business.  He hopes to continue working and maintaining a good credit record.

With the previous loan, he was able to fulfill the demand of his customers and earn better profits that have served to cover the his family's needs.  He also bought a computer and printer so that his son can be up to date with his studies.

loans.use: to buy a new freezer to increase ice production for his business and to continue working and maintaining a good credit record

loans.name: Judy Ann

texts.en:
This is Judy Ann, 18, single, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a business minded and a diligent student who helps her parents meet their daily sustenance and fund her school requirements. 

Judy Ann is a coconut dealer. In the Philippines, coconuts are sold in the market or on the streets. Coconut vendors have a bolo knife, a shredder or scraper, and a pitcher that they use as they push their carts full of coconuts through the streets to peddle. One buko (coconut) usually costs 23 PHP to 25 PHP, juice and meat included. The coconuts are served in two ways: one end of it is cut with a straw in it, to serve as the container itself, or coconuts can be offered wherein the juice and the edible part of the coconut are put into a plastic bag with a straw. Regular customers are those who are thirsty and those who want to refresh themselves from the heat of the sun. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting 19,000 PHP loan to buy more sacks of coconuts to sell to her customers. Due to the tropical nature of the Philippines and the abundance of coconut in the country, Judy Ann is doing fine with what she earns, especially during the summer season. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP a day in sales. She thanks God and you for the financial help that will be extended to her.

Judy Ann believes that her business will continue to be successful and hopes to buy a truck for her coconut business. She is positive that she will reach her dream to earn a College degree. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of coconut to sell

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en: Gulbahor is a brave woman. She was born in 1994. She is living in a remote district. She is from the southern part of a country. She is a teacher. She teaches students at a secondary school. Separately, she studies part time at university. She is capable, communicable, honest and active student and teacher. The salary that she earns in her job is not enough to pay her tuition fee for university. Gulbahor is asking financial support from KIVA to pay the tuition fee for education. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee for education

loans.name: Zainab M.

texts.en: This is thirty-five year-old Zainab.  She is married, and has three children aged sixteen, twelve and six. In 2008, Zainab established her Groundnut business. She voluntarily left school and her mother gave her money to start a plastic business. After she got married her husband added to her capital and she started a groundnut business. Her customers are men and women. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,100,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Zainab requires a loan in order to buy bags of groundnuts, Irish potatoes and onions. She hopes that this loan will help to increase stock and generate more income. In the future, Zainab plans to complete the payment for a piece of land, promise quality education for her children and improve the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for groundnuts

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo es un padre de familia de 70 años de edad, esta solamente juntado con su esposa con la que tiene 7 hijos de las edades entre 19 y 29 años, vive en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Gonzalo a pesar de su avanzada edad para él no es ningún impedimento para no trabajar, el para mantener a su familia desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura cultivando una diversidad de verduras tales como arveja, tomate y maíz, esta actividad él lo realiza porque en el lugar donde él vive es una zona muy fértil que produce buenas verduras, Pero Gonzalo  ahora ha pensado cultivar arveja criolla por ser la época, pero Gonzalo tiene un impedimento de que no cuenta con suficiente capital para realizar la siembra, Pero él ha pensado y decidió solicitar  un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para comprar sus semillas de arveja, fertilizantes para poder empezar a cultivar.
El gran anhelo  de Gonzalo es poder conseguir el prestamo para poder cultivar para poder exportar sus productos a otro país y hacer que esta inversión le deje buenas ganancias
texts.en:
Gonzalo is a 70-year-old father. He and his wife live by themselves. They have seven children between the ages of 19 and 29. Gonzalo resides in the community of San Andrés Semetabaj.

Despite his advanced age, Gonzalo doesn’t see it as an impediment that keeps him from working. He is still able to sustain his family after being in the agriculture trade for 20 years. Gonzalo cultivates a variety of vegetables such as peas, tomatoes, and corn. He is able to do this type of work because the place where he lives is in a fertile area that produces good vegetables.

Gonzalo is now planning to cultivate native peas since it is the right season. His only obstacle is that he does not have sufficient capital to begin planting. For this reason, he decided to request a loan of 4,000 GTQ in order to buy pea seeds and fertilizers so that he can begin planting.

Gonzalo’s greatest wish is to secure the loan for cultivation so that he can export his products to another country. Making such an investment will produce good earnings.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Mawela Group

texts.en:
COLMAN who is in his early 40s is divorcee and has no children.  He has been running two projects, a retail shop and in the same shop sells at wholesale prices.  He works from 8.30 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be COLMAN's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to increase the inventory for both the retail and the wholesale areas of his business, and has managed to pay back his loan successfully. 

He used the profits to take care of himself and covered household expenses.  He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  Once again, he will use this loan to increase inventory on the retail and wholesale sides of his business to meet his customers' demand.  He dreams of having capital without a loan.

COLMAN will share this loan with his loan group "Mawela" which consist of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his retail and wholesale business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the inventory of her general store

loans.name: Witthong Feliberto

texts.es:
Witthong radica en Santo Domingo de los Colorados, zona cálida húmeda y conocida en el país por la etnia Tsachila que habita en el sector.  Con 38 años, él  vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos varones, cuentan con casa propia la misma que la ha podido construir gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo durante todos estos años.
Witthong desde muy pequeño aprendió de su padre el arte de la construcción de viviendas, es por ello que hace 15 años él se ha dedicado de lleno a este servicio, lo contratan porque realiza buen trabajo; construye escaleras, cisternas, construye viviendas. Le ha ido muy bien ya que gracias a este trabajo él ha podido llevar el sustento a su hogar y darles la educación a sus hijos.
Acudió a Fundación Alternativa hace varios meses donde ya recibió crédito, ahora se encuentra en la renovación, con el que invertirá en la compra de balanceado par sus pollos ya que gracias a los créditos de la Fundación a podido incrementar mas negocios, se siente muy feliz ya que ha creció como microempresario.
texts.en:
Witthong lives in Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a warm, humid zone that is known in the country for the ethnic Tsachila who live in the sector. At the age of 38, he lives with his wife and three sons. They have their own house, which he has been able to construct as a result of the effort that he has put into his work throughout all these years.

When he was very young, Witthong learned the art of constructing houses from his father. It is for this reason that for the past 15 years he has made a living providing this service. People hire him because he performs great work. He builds staircases, cisterns, and houses. He has done very well, and as a result of this work he has been able to put food on the table for his family and to give his sons an education.

He turned to Fundacion Alternativa several months ago and received a loan. Now he is looking to renew that loan, which he will use to buy balanced feed for his chickens. Thanks to the loans that he has received from Fundacion Alternativa, he has been able to establish more businesses. He is very happy because he has grown as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his chickens.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is an artisan who specializes in ceramic and wood vases. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including paint and oxides.

Omar has been selling through NOVICA since 2014. This is his story:

"I express my creativity through my art, ceramics. My friends say that I'm a happy person, a jokester, and quite creative. I am a man of many convictions and I will defend them. People say of me that I am a good father, and that is what I value the most. In 1988 I started designing low temperature ceramics. I've had to learn and unlearn many things; not every experience is the same. I've experimented a lot, invented tools, made trials and performed many tests. I have a very close working relationship with my friend, ceramist Mariela Ticay, and we agreed that each one will sign the piece they painted, and we make decisions together. My inspiration comes from indigenous traditions and my country's natural beauty. I am also inspired by textile patterns that, when abstracted, transfer well to ceramics, thus creating something uniquely modern while remaining ethnic. Our workshop offers direct and indirect employment – a venture like ours is a vital source of work as it provides for many families."

Thanks, friends, for your support through this microcredit. It represents a little push forward that helps improve my business."

Use the link below to view Omar's ceramic and wood vases on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/9412

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including paint and oxides

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.en:
Victor Hugo is 21 years old, single, and works with his cousins in a food stall were they sell Mexican food such as meat tacos.  

He is asking for a loan to open a new food stall and become independent. 

He says that he is passionate about this line of work, and has been doing it for seven years. 

He has already bought some of the required fixed assets with savings, and is asking for the loan to buy food inventory and a little working capital. 

His goal is to own a business and become independent.

loans.use: To buy food inventory

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 38 years old; he lives with his wife and three sons. He has a construction supply store; he works in the business with his wife. He also works with his father-in-law during the weekends delivering products. He started the business 16 years ago, and has been able to make it grow. He also saved to buy a truck. 

He is asking for a loan to buy inventory.  

His goal is to keep improving and to open a new store in a different location.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his construction supply store.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a single mother and lives in her parents house. She started the business out of necessity, she found a local place near her house that used to be a store, and she decided to take it and open her grocery store. 

Through hard work she has been able to grow her business and support her son. 

She is asking for a loan to restock her store and continue to make it grow.

loans.use: To restock her grocery store.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.en:
Julio Alberto is 21 years old and single.  He works in his parents business; it is a restaurant where they sell chicken soups. He has been working there for the last three years. 

Julio Alberto is asking for a loan because he wants to learn to speak English, so he will be paying for the course. 

He finished high school and also obtained a technical degree in computing, so he believes that speaking English is critical to finding a good job and continue to grow professionally.

loans.use: To pay for a course to learn English.

loans.name: Orepa

texts.en:
Orepa is a 46-year-old mother of 4 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. 

Orepa has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei design, containers, and a printing machine to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Orepa hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei design, containers, and a printing machine

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is 57 years old and has 4 children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Hani has requested a loan to buy bananas tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her to run the business. 

Hani joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her business profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Her name is Gerlie, 32, and she is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married and has three children of which the eldest is already in high school; the other two are still in the elementary level.

She manages her household while operating a business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs, and to send her children to school. 

Gerlie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also has a boarding house for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 1,000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, chips, sacks of rice, beverages, toiletries and other grocery stuff. 

She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely cover their daily sustenance and school needs of her children.

Gerlie hopes to maintain and grow her business so she could save for the college education of her children. She strives to hard to give her children the best education and prays for a Godly and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
This is Catherine, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, a businessman, and they have two children, one of which is still in the preparatory level and the other one is not of school-age yet. She manages her household while operating a business to augment their income and provide for the needs of her family.

Catherine has a fruit shake stand business. She buys different kinds of fruits such as bananas, mangoes, and pineapples, and mixes them and makes them into fruit shakes. Fruits are generally high in fiber, water, vitamin C that are good for the health. Due to the tropical nature of the Philippines, there is an abundance of these fruits, and as more and more people are becoming health conscious, the fruit shake business is a good venture. The combination of fruits makes it a favorite refreshing and yummy drink, both to the locals and foreigners, especially this summer season.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting for an PHP11,000 loan which she will use to buy mangoes, bananas, pineapples, and coconuts to make fruit shakes to sell at her fruit stand. 

She earns a minimum of 600 a day in sales. She is thanking God for a good return on her investment, and the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help fund their everyday needs.

Catherine hopes that her business will continue to be successful to save for the education of her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fruits such as bananas, mangoes, pineapple and coconuts

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia sells buttons and clothing accessories, and her husband is a taxi driver. The couple have their own house. 

Natalia is a hardworking person, and she needs a loan to buy more buttons and clothing accessories because it is necessary for her to improve her quality of life. If things get better, Natalia will be buying more clothing accessories in the future. 

Natalia and her husband have two sons.

loans.use: to buy more buttons and clothing accessories

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is thirty-seven year-old Salamatu.  She is married, and has four children aged fifteen, eleven, seven and one. 

In 2005, Salamatu established her Bags of groundnut business. She began her business because she dropped out of school due to lack of sponsorship. 
Her aunt gave her a small amount of money to start selling cake, she accumulated some money, and changed the business to selling groundnuts. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business.  

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy additional bags of groundnuts and Irish potatoes.   She hopes that this loan will help to increase her inventory and generate more income.   

In the future, she plans to educate her children, expand the business, and buy a piece of land.   

She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to increase her inventory of groundnuts

loans.name: Usep

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Usep. Usep lives in Sumedang, a town in West Java located about a four hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his two daughters. 

Usep owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services for his community. He joined Ruma a year ago. He learned of Ruma from his friend who had joined Ruma before him. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to save more money, together with his wife, for his children's future education. Usep has a strong will to be a better person, and his community sees him as a friendly mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Usep is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services for his community. 

Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Usep improves his business and accordingly, his community, who needs access to such services.  Usep’s goal with Ruma in the nearly future is serving as an e-commerce business for his community. 

As seen in the photo, Usep is the one who is standing in front of his own stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and electricity bill payments

loans.name: Umi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! It’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Uma.  Uma lives in Pekalongan, a city located about a 2 hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia, by plane. She lives there with her husband and her child. She owns a stall where she sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services for her community. 

She has been a member of Ruma for almost a year. She knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executives that came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to try another business venture. Her community sees her as a trusted and cheerful mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Uma is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community. Your loan will be very useful to help Uma improve her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services.  

Uma’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to start an e-commerce business for her community. As seen in the photo, Uma is the one who is standing in her own stall. She will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc.) for members of her local community

loans.name: Agung

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Agung. Agung lives in North Bogor, a suburban area located about a one hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his two children. He works as a freelance laborer.  He joined Ruma a year ago, and now he is serving mobile services for his community, such as selling mobile airtime credits and providing electricity bill payments. He learned of Ruma from the Ruma sales executive that came to his house. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to start up a business. Agung has a strong will to learn about everything, and that’s what makes him a good mobile provider.

As the business grows, Agung is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to his community. 

Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Agung improve his business and accordingly, his community, who needs access to such services.  Agung’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community.  

As seen in the photo, Agung is the one who is standing and holding Ruma’s banner. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and electricity bill payments

loans.name: Anosi

texts.en:
Anosi is a 44-year-old mother of 6 children.  She runs a small business of selling fruit salad in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a  year. 

Anosi has requested a loan to buy a cooler, a box of fruits (apple, pineapple, mango), plastic cups, a box of milk, and ice bags to assist her with the business. 

She will expand her business using her profits. 

Anosi became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, a box of fruit (apple, pineapple, mango), plastic cups, a box of milk, and ice bags

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Her store er earnings helped send her child to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Aside from her store she also has a "videoke" and billiard business for added income. She is thanks God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her for it will surely cover their daily sustenance. 

Amie dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her child the best education possible to allow her better opportunities in life. She desires for a stable future for her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
Nataly es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 8 años y un bebe de 4 meses, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, amable, buena oyente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘Comarapa’ de la zona plan 3000 un área caracterizada por ser un centro producción donde microempresarios de todas las áreas, como la costura, el diseño y las artesanías, imitan productos extranjeros que se comercializan en los principales mercados locales, es el barrio más poblado de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-35 grados centígrados.
Nataly es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por el negocio que realiza (de pie a la izquierda, viste polera blanca). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio de refrescos y son sus hijos el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor es un bebé, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus ganas por mejorar y ampliar su negocio para darle bienestar a su familia la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; llantería, venta de artículos para baño, venta de postres, confección de sábanas, venta de carne de cerdo, venta de accesorios para automóvil y venta de frutas, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), y otros, actividad que realiza en las afueras de su domicilio bajo un par de sombrillas, 4 mesas y sillas, de lunes a sábado para la hora de almuerzo y cena. “inicié mi negocio cocinando un plato de comida, luego lo amplié mi menú, ahora necesito continuar mejorando mi oferta de comida…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante amplio y con todas las comodidades para sus clientes, ella desea aumentar las variedades de comidas mediante la compra de un horno industrial. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Nataly solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial para cocinar nuevas comidas y mejorar su menú diario.
texts.en:
Nataly is a 29-year-old woman who lives with her partner. They have two children, an eight-year-old and a four-month-old baby. Her business involves selling traditional food.

Nataly is a good mother who is independent, enterprising, friendly, a good listener, responsible, and hardworking. She conducts her business in the neighborhood of Comarapa in the Plan 3000 District, an area known for being a production center where all types of small entrepreneurs can be found. These include seamstresses, designers, and artisans who recreate foreign products and sell them at the main local markets. Comarapa is the most populated neighborhood in the city. It has a warm tropical climate with a temperature that varies throughout the day between 18-35 degrees Celsius.

Nataly has a dark complexion, long black hair that is tied back, dark eyes, a short stature, and a robust physique. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, but she also speaks Spanish in order to conduct business. In the photo, she is standing on the left and wearing a white shirt. She shares her life with her partner, who sells soft drinks, and their children. Her older child is in school and the younger one is still a baby. They live in their own house made of brick and cement. It has running water, electricity, and sewage service. Her drive to improve and expand her business has allowed her to provide for her family’s well-being. Nataly is the leader of a Communal Bank that includes people who sell and repair tires, sell bath products, sell desserts, manufacture bed sheets, sell pork, sell automobile accessories, and sell fruit. They are requesting a loan so that they can improve their business activities.

Nataly’s business involves selling traditional food such as “majadito de charque” [beef jerky served with rice, a fried egg, and fried plantains, bone marrow soup, “cojote relleno” [chicken necks stuffed with potatoes and offal], peanut soup, and other dishes. She operates her business outside of her home under a pair of umbrellas, along with four sets of tables and chairs. Her business is open for lunch and dinner, Monday through Saturday. “I started my business with one dish and later I expanded my menu. Now I need to continue improving my food,” Nataly says. Her dream is to have a large restaurant with all of the comforts for her customers. She wants to expand the variety of food that she offers by purchasing an industrial oven. Nataly is participating in her first loan cycle with Emprender. She has been working independently at her business for the past three years.

For the reasons previously mentioned, Nataly is requesting a loan in order to buy an industrial oven so that she can prepare new dishes and improve her daily menu.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven.

loans.name: Gina Susana

texts.es:
Gina es madre soltera, vive con su pequeño hijo en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, ciudad conocida porque en ella habita la etnia Tsachila. Ciudad conocida además por el gran intercambio comercial que existe ya que es un puente terrestre donde une a la sierra y a la costa del país.
Gina es una señora muy trabajadora, desde hace varios años atrás ella ha trabajado como cocinera en restaurantes de la zona, ya luego de varios años ella decidió emprender su negocio, cuenta con un pequeño comedor en un sitio muy concurrido, trabaja en el terminal terrestre de la ciudad donde ya es muy conocida por el personal que trabaja en dicha empresa, ya que por su sazón acuden a comer en su comedor.
Gina a pesar de no contar con el padre de sus hijos ella ha podido salir adelante con la ayuda de su familia, es una señora muy responsable. 
Gina acudió a Fundación Alternativa, con este crédito ella podrá comprarse otra cocina y mejorar su local, se siente feliz porque la institución le abrió las puertas, está muy agradecida ya que así podrá dar mejor atención a su clientela.
texts.en:
Gina is a single mother. She lives with her little son in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a city that is known for the ethnic Tsachila people who live there. The city is also known for the great commercial exchange that exists there, since it is a terrestrial bridge where the mountains and the coast of the country meet.

Gina is a very hard-working woman. For a number of years she has worked as a cook in restaurants in the area. Then a number of years ago she decided to set up her business. She has a little dining hall in a location with a lot of traffic. She works in the land terminal of the city, where she is already very well known by the people who work in that business, since they come to eat in her restaurant because of her tasty cooking.

Gina, in spite of not having her child's father [present], has been able to get ahead with the help of her family. She is a very responsible woman.

Gina turned to Fundación Alternativa. With this loan she will be able to buy another stove and improve her premises. She feels happy because the institution opened its doors to her. She is very grateful, since this way she will be able to give better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy another stove and improve her premises

loans.name: Ermes

texts.es: ERMES: Es un originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 35 años de edad, casado con 2 hijos: El mayor de  6 años de edad estudia su primer grado de primaria y el menor de 3 años. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una vivienda más digna y segura para su familia, solicita su primer financiamiento para construir un cuarto de madera para sus hijos, mejorar su vivienda que es de  madera y tambo. Con su préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es llegar a tener una vivienda de concreto (cemento) porque es de mayor durabilidad y dedicarse al engorde y comercialización de cerdos, para contar con otra fuente de ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ermes is a native of Puerto Cabezas. He is 35 years old and married, with two children. The older one is 6 years old and is in the first grade of primary school, and the younger one is 3. With the goal of improving the conditions of his home and having a more worthy and safe dwelling for his family, he is applying for his first financing to build a room of wood for his children and to improve his house, which is made of wood and is on stilts. 

With his loan, he wants to buy construction materials: wood, zinc [galvanized metal sheets], and nails and pay the costs of labor. His dream is to be able to have a house of concrete (cement) because it is of greater durability. 

He fattens and sells pigs in order to have another source of income and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to build a room of wood for his children and improve his house, which is made of wood and is on stilts.

loans.name: Hector Ovidio

texts.es:
Hector es un hombre de 36 años de edad es casado, cuenta con una linda familia de 3 hijos varones, de las edades entre 4 y 9 años, viven en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Hector es un hombre trabajador y perseverante que día a día se dedica con amor a su labor para que a su familia no le haga falta nada,  Hector para generar sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de blusas típicas de su región, el realiza esta labor desde hace 3 años, según cuneta Hector que gracias a este pequeño negocio él ha logrado mantener a su familia, el desde hace algún tiempo ha pensado en incrementar este pequeño negocio pero una de las dificultades que Hector ha tenido es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente que requiere el negocio, pero en estos últimos días él se ha dado cuenta que contar con un prestamo es la mejor solución, por tal motivo él solicita un prestamo con el que pretende comprar más blusas de diferentes estilos y colores para luego venderlos a un buen precio.
El gran sueño de Hector es realizar esta inversión para mejorar sus ingresos y así poder seguir ayudando a sus hijos en la escuela para que se gradúen y puedan conseguir un trabajo.
texts.en:
Hector is a 36-year-old man who is married and has a beautiful family that includes three sons between the ages of 4 and 9. They live in the community of San Andrés Semetabaj.

Hector is a hardworking and persevering man who goes about his work each day with love so that his family lacks nothing. He earns his income by buying and selling traditional blouses produced in the region. Hector has been doing this type of work for three years. Thanks to this small business, he says that he has been able to sustain his family. Some time ago, Hector planned to increase his small business, but one of the difficulties he faced was the not having sufficient operating capital. In recent days, he realized that the best solution would be to apply for a loan. For this reason, he is requesting a loan with the intention of buying more blouses in different styles and colors. He will eventually sell them at a good price.

Hector’s greatest wish is to carry out this investment so that he can improve his earnings. As a result, he can continue sending his children to school so that they can graduate and secure jobs.

loans.use: to buy traditional blouses in different styles and colors.

loans.name: Konbatan Sapoti

texts.en:
Tancimene (in front in the picture) is a lady who spends time in helping the poor community. As an economic alternative, she created a solidarity group in 2012 in a neighborhood in the south of Port-au-Prince. Her objective was clear: tackle economic problems that many families were facing. Democratically elected president, she runs the committee board with JeanFrid (left) and Wiliana (right). 

Her group operates as a VSLA  (village savings and loans association), and it is a social support for its members in time of funerals. This group closed its cycle of credit two months ago. They now hope to find an additional investment from Zafen for the current cycle.

loans.use: to purchase 250 sacks of food products to retail.

loans.name: Asael Audi

texts.es:
Asael, de 27 años de edad, se graduó de bachiller en el año 2008, se casó hace dos años, su esposa trabaja de secretaria en una clínica privada del pueblo en donde residen, por el momento no tiene hijos. 

Asael, trabaja sembrando hortalizas, le enseño su papá desde que tenía nueve años de edad, también ha trabajado como ordeñador de vacas, son trabajos de campo que no tienen horarios fijos. Actualmente, siembra tomates, yuca. 

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar insumos para la siembra de tomates y yuca y así poder seguir generando ingresos a su hogar, junto a su esposa y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

El sueño de Asael, es poder instalar la luz eléctrica en su casa, ya que en su comunidad está lejos de la ciudad y nadie tiene energía eléctrica.- Además, desea comprar tubos para traer el agua desde el nacimiento, hasta las hortalizas y para su consumo.- Con las ventas de las hortalizas ha construido su pequeña casa y poco a poco espera además ponerle el piso a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Asael is 27 years old and graduated from high school in 2008. He married two years ago. His wife works as a secretary in a private hospital in the town where they live. At the moment they have no children.

Asael works growing vegetables. His father taught him from when he was nine years old. He has also worked milking cows. This is fieldwork that does not have fixed hours of work. Currently he is growing tomatoes and yuca. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy agricultural supplies for growing tomatoes, enabling him and his wife to continue generating income for their household and have a better quality of life.

Asael's dream is to be able to install electricity in his home, as their community is far from the city, and nobody has electricity. In addition, he wants to buy pipes to bring water from the source to the vegetables and for his own use. With the sales of the vegetables he has built a small house, and little by little also hopes to install a floor in his home.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies for growing tomatoes and yuca.

loans.name: La Fortaleza Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Carmela es una mujer de 37 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de productos naturales para la salud.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, de buen trato, responsable y trabajadora. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que todavía no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona sur de la ciudad; caracterizada por las redes viales que conectan a la ciudad, los suelos de esta parte son predominantemente arenas, arenas finas y otras limosas, de clima cálido subtropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 19-35 grados centígrados, donde los meses que más llueves son enero y febrero. 
Carmela es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo lo usa suelto,  su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (al centro viste vestido a rayas rojo y blanco). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que son bebés, viven en una casa perteneciente a la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; taller de reparación, venta de bisutería, venta de comida, panadería, tienda de barrio, confección de ropa y venta de ropa de niños, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de productos naturales para la salud, como; suplementos para nutrición básica, suplementos para nutrición específica, deportes y vida activa, nutrición externa, etc., labor que realiza de forma ambulante todos los días de la semana y a toda hora. “esta actividad me da la satisfacción de ayudar a las personas a cambiar su estilo de vida, muchos clientes me agradecen por la satisfacción que tienen…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta fijo para dejar de ambular, ella desea realizar la compra de productos naturales para nutrición por mayor para contar con una mayor oferta. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Carmela solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos nutricionales por mayor para ayudar a las personas a cambiar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Carmela is a woman of 37. She is single and has two children, ages 2 and 3, and her business is selling natural health products. 

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, patient, giving fair treatment, responsible, and hard-working. She shares her life with her children, who still are not of school age. They live in a rented house that is made of bricks and cement and has potable water, electrical energy, and sewer service. She runs her business in the southern zone of the city, which is characterized by road networks that connect to the city. The soils of this part are predominantly sand, fine sand, and other loams. It has a warm subtropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 19 - 35 degrees centigrade, and the months when it rains the most are January and February.

Carmela has golden-brown skin and chestnut hair that she wears loose. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture and for her business. (She is at the center of the photo wearing a red-and-white striped dress.) She shares her life with her children, who are babies. They live in a house belonging to a relative that is made of bricks and cement, with a tile roof and potable water, electrical energy, and sewer service. 

Her desires to achieve brought her to lead a loan group of people with businesses such as a repair shop, selling jewelry, selling food, a bakery, a neighborhood store, making clothing, and selling children's clothing in order to apply for a loan and improve their businesses. Her business is selling natural health products such as supplements for basic nutrition, and supplements for specific nutrition, sports, and active life [styles], outer nutrition, etc. She does this work as a street vendor every day of the week at every hour. "This activity gives me the satisfaction of helping people to change their life styles. Many customers thank me because of the satisfaction that they have," she comments. 

Her dream is to have a fixed sales stand so that she can stop walking around. She wants to purchase natural nutritional products wholesale in order to have more to offer. This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in the 5 years that she has been running this business in an independent form.

It is for these reasons that Carmela is applying for a loan to purchase nutritional products wholesale in order to help people to change their life styles.

loans.use: to buy nutritional products wholesale in order to help people change their life style

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor, de 34 años de edad, está divorciada y es madre de 2 hijos, los cuales viven con ella y estudian.

Flor, trabaja como directora de la casa de la cultura, le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque organiza las actividades culturales de su pueblo y al mismo tiempo enseña a sus hijos la importancia de la cultura.

Flor, necesita el crédito para ampliar su casa, pues sus hijos están creciendo y necesitan más espacio y mejores condiciones.
 
Flor, desea seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos a que se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Flor is 34 years old, divorced, and the mother of two children who live with her and are in school. She works as the director of a cultural events center. Flor greatly enjoys her work because she organizes cultural activities in her town. At the same, she teaches children the importance of culture.

Flor needs a loan in order to expand her house. Her children are growing, so they need more space and better conditions. Flor wants to continue working so that she can help her children become prepared academically.

loans.use: to expand her house.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca, práctica la crianza de ganado, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, uno de ellos le ayuda a cuidar del ganado y su hija menor estudia y le colaborar con las actividades del hogar, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en su negocio, lo aprendió con ayuda de su ex esposo, en su residencia compra y vende ganado, lo hace a tiempo completo.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar dos vaquillas incrementara su inventario y en el futuro contara con más cabezas de ganado y con la leche podrá producir lácteos para vender y dar una mejor alimentación a  su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son que su hija menor estudie una carrera universitaria y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca raises cattle. She is 39 years old and a single mother of two children. One child helps with looking after the cattle and her young daughter studies and helps with the household chores. Blanca has more than 10 years of experience in this business since learning the trade with the help of her ex-husband. She buys and sells cattle from her home on a full-time basis.

Blanca will use the loan to buy two heifers to increase her herd. In the future, she will acquire two more head of cattle. She will sell the milk that they produce so that she can provide more food for her family.

Her aspirations are to help her young daughter study for a university degree and to remodel her home.

loans.use: to buy two heifers to increase her herd.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos, 38 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y tiene dos hijas, una de 15 años y la menor de 7 años de edad, su esposa se dedica al cuidado de sus hijas y a los oficios domésticos.

Carlos, se dedica a la agricultura, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres y casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a ello, ya que desde que tenia doce años cultiva la tierra, además trabaja de corralero cuidando ganado y criando cerdos.

El crédito lo utilizará para reparar las paredes de su casa, ya que es de barro y están agrietadas y tiene miedo que les vaya a caer encima.

Sus sueños son, terminar de reparar su casa en su totalidad y agradece a kiva la oportunidad que le da por optar a un crédito, ya que sin ello no logrará hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Carlos, 38, has a 6th grade education.  He is married and has 2 daughters aged 15 and 7.  His wife takes care of the children and the domestic chores.

Carlos is a farmer.  He learned to farm from his parents, and he's been farming almost all of his life.  Ever since he was 12 years old, he has cultivated the land.  In addition, he also works caring for livestock and raising pigs.

Carlos will use this loan to repair the walls of his house, because they are made of mud and are cracked, and he fears that they are going to fall down.  

Carlos dreams of completely fixing his home.  He is grateful to Kiva for the opportunity that he is receiving to take a loan, because without this, he would not be able to make his dreams a reality.

loans.use: to repair the walls of his home

loans.name: Angela Veronica

texts.es:
Ángela, tiene la necesidad de incrementar su inventario por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, con ello podrá seguir mejorando su negocio y su situación financiera.
El apoyo que obtiene de créditos le está permitiendo seguir trabajando y generando los ingresos que tanto necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Angela needs to increase her inventory so she is requesting a new loan to buy pigs and concentrate to feed them. With this loan, she will be able to keep improving her business and her financial situation. 

The help she gets from loans is allowing her to keep working and generating the income that she needs so much to be able to get by with her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrate to feed them. With this loan, she will be able to keep improving her business and her financial situation.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia tiene la edad  de 45 años, está casada, vive con el esposo y un hijo. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para un almacigal de café, para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias . Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Leticia is 45 years old, married, and lives with her husband and child. She intends to use her loan to buy fertilizers, fungicides, and also pay for labor to handle the maintenance work for a coffee nursery. Leticia would like to begin replanting at the start of the rainy season. By improving her crop, she hopes to achieve slightly better earnings so that she can improve her family’s living conditions and also invest more into cultivation. She would also like to accomplish a few other goals.

This is the first loan Leticia has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any previous loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR is offering this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee nursery and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Zhumagul

texts.ru: Жумагул 50 лет, вдова. У Жумагул среднее образование, с 2005 года она стала заниматься животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 20 овец. Жумагул работает дезинфектором, получая заработную плату в размере 8,527 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход от ведения бизнеса доходит до 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумагул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита позволят Жумагул накопить на покупку квартиры.
texts.en: Zhumagul is 50 years old and a widow. She has received secondary education. Since 2005 she has been raising livestock. At present she has six cows and 20 sheep on her farm. Zhumagul works as a disinfection specialist and receives a [monthly] salary of 8,527 KGS. Her monthly income from her farm can reach 10,000 KGS. In order to develop her farm further, Zhumagul has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy calves. The resulting revenues will help Zhumagul save up for buying an apartment.

loans.use: to buy additional calves

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is a 32-year-old mother with 7 children. She runs a small business of selling toasted tuna sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Elisapeta has requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, butter and mayonnaise to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. Elisapeta became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, butter and mayonnaise

loans.name: Fathirah

texts.en: Fathirah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, who both go to school. She has no additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She would like to increase her stock levels so as to attract more customers. She lives in a rented house with access to electricity and no access to piped water. Her major expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: Loise is 40 years old with 4 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Loise has requested a loan to buy banana seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2015, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is a 59-year-old mother with 9 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Makerita has requested for a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei designs, containers, and printing machine to assist her to run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. Makerita hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2007.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine

loans.name: Faimasasa

texts.en: Faimasasa is 56 years old with 7 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Faimasasa has requested a loan to buy banana seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, and a pick-up (car) to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2008, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals and a pick-up (car)

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул, 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 2 детей. У Нургул среднее образование, уже много лет она занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 46 коров, 15 овец. На участке мерою 2,4 Га выращивают люцерну и пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход Нургул составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Нургул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, она хочет накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Nurgul is 54 years old and married.  She and her husband have raised two children. Nurgul has a secondary education and she has been involved in agriculture for many years already.  She currently has 46 cows and 15 sheep on her farm.  She also grows alfalfa and wheat on 2.4 hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy additional livestock and increase the size of her herd.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her numbers of domestic animals.  She also wants to save enough money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Tilnara

texts.ru: Тилнара, 53 года, замужем, 3 детей. У Тилнары высшее образование, с 1998 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. Она жизнерадостный и ответственный человек. У нее в хозяйстве есть корова, 10 овец, а также есть 1,50 ГА арендованной и 1,60 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает фасоль. На сегодняшний день деятельность Тилнары приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Tilnara is 53, married, and has three children.  She has a university education, and has been a farmer since 1998 to earn some additional money.  She is a cheerful and responsible person.  She has a cow and 10 sheep on her farm, as well as 1.50 hectares of rented land and 1.60 hectares of her own land for growing beans.  Her business currently brings in a monthly profit of 10,000 som.  

For the future development of her business, she's requested a loan of 50,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to go towards buying 10 sheep.  She plans on using her extra income due to the loan to develop her farm, and also intends to renovate her home.

loans.use: buy 10 sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: weed, buy fertilizer and harvest

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en: Rejoice is a 28-year-old mother with 2 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Rejoice has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint, paint brushes, elei design, containers and a printing machine, to assist her run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. Rejoice hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint, paint brushes, elei design, containers, and a printing machine

loans.name: Sifaga

texts.en: Sifaga is a 34-year-old mother with 3 children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cake and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Sifaga has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon and a frypan to assist her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. Sifaga  joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon and a frypan

loans.name: Silisa

texts.en: Silisa is a 36-year-old mother with 8 children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Silisa has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon and frypan to help her in the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. Silisa  joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon and frypan

loans.name: Agnella

texts.en:
Agnella is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Agnella operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for more than 3 years. She mentioned a disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Agnella dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Meali operates a grocery and vegetable-selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Carmen Elizabeth

texts.es:
Carmen Elizabeth vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, ciudad caracterizada por su crecimiento comercial, la misma que se encuentra ubicada en la costa Ecuatoriana siendo el puente terrestre que une a varias regiones del país.
Carmen vive junto a sus hijas en casa de familiares, comenta que hace varios años por problemas del hogar se separó del padre de sus hijas, desde ahí se le ha hecho más duro pero no imposible para sacar adelante sola a su hogar.
Desde hace muchos años Carmen trabajaba en un taller de costura donde prestaba el servicio de maquilada, pero al verse preocupada ya que no pasaba mucho tiempo con sus hijas, hace más de un año emprendió sola poniéndose su propio taller de costura ahora sí en su hogar, para estar pendiente de ellas. Al principio se le hizo duro hasta hacerse conocer de la gente por su trabajo, ahora está muy feliz ya que gracias a lo que hace ella ha podido salir adelante sola.
Carmen está creciendo poco a poco como microempresaria, actualmente cuenta con dos máquinas, por ello con este crédito comprará dos máquinas más y telas ya que se acerca la temporada estudiantil y es cuando necesita de herramienta básica. 
Carmen se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le han brindado, porque ella ahora se siente más segura para poder salir adelante, está feliz porque ninguna otra institución le dio la mano como Fundación Alternativa y el proyecto Kiva.
texts.en:
Carmen Elizabeth lives in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, which is characterized by commercial growth and is located on the Ecuadorian coast. It is the land bridge uniting various regions of the country. 

Carmen lives with her daughters at the home of family members. She says she separated from her daughters’ father a few years ago due to problems at home. Since then it has been hard, but not impossible, for her to get by on her own at home. 

A few years ago Carmen worked in a sewing studio where she offered assembly services, but realizing she was worried because she wasn’t spending much time with her children, she set out to set up her own sewing studio in her home, to be able to look after them. At first, it was hard for her to make herself known for her work, but she is very happy now because thanks to what she does she has been able to get by on her own.

Little by little, Carmen is growing as a microentrepreneur. She currently has two sewing machines, so with this loan she will buy two more and fabric since the school year is coming up and that’s when she needs basic tools.

Carmen feels happy and thankful for the opportunity she has been given because she now feels more secure to be able to move forward. She is happy because no other institution has given her a hand like Fundación Alternativa and the Kiva project.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines and fabric for the school year

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en:
Zaitun is a married woman with one child, who is too young to attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking a long time to repay loans. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 60 years old with 3 children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Ana has requested a loan to buy banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals to assist her in the business. She joined SPBD in 2001, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube seedlings, taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
This is Joy, 39, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. He is married to Jenelyn and has two children who attend high school. He has a backyard business to provide for their daily personal and household needs and for the school requirements of his children.

Joy has been a hog raiser for six years already. Investing in a piggery is a good and profitable business as female pigs conceive twice in a year and can produce as many as 12 piglets each time.  Aside from raising hogs, Joy, being a hardworking man, is also an Avon dealer.

To help him raise healthy hogs he is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan which he will use to buy more feed and clean grain and add piglets for sale. He is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on his healthy hogs and the financial help that will be given to him will surely help cover their daily living expenses. 

Joy aims to sustain and grow his piggery backyard business to have a better life. He strives hard to send his children to school to allow them better opportunities in life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feeds and add piglets for sale.

loans.name: Ma. Marilyn

texts.en:
Ma.Marilyn is thankful that she was granted a PHP 15,000 loan which she used to buy raw ingredients needed in her small restaurant. She is now married to Jayson, a military man. Her earnings helped in their daily sustenance.
