She would like to apply for a PHP 20,000 which she will use to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products to cook dishes to sell at her restaurant. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her for it will surely fund their everyday needs, 

Ma.Marilyn dreams of improving and expanding her restaurant to attract more customers. She hopes to lead a healthy and victorious life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients to cook meals in her small restaurant

loans.name: Petrolina

texts.en:
Petrolina  is a married woman with six kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Petrolina operates a grocery and vegetable-selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.
 
With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with three children who attends school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For over three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase a bale of kids clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of kids clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr:
Ramatoulaye âgée de la trentaine d’année, célibataire sans enfant, loge à quelques mètres du guichet de l’IMCEC. Elle a récemment ouvert son compte et vient juste de bénéficier de son premier crédit afin d’acheter des condiments : oignons, pomme de terre, épices, poulets…, nécessaires à la préparation des mets qu’elle propose à sa clientèle. Ramatoulaye emploie deux femmes qui l’appuient dans la cuisson et est ouvert de 7h du matin à 23h 30mn.
 Elle a donc comme charges, le salaire de ses employés et les petites charges de fonctionnement
Son désir est d’agrandir son activité et d’augmenter son capital afin d’ouvrir un autre restaurant.
texts.en:
Ramatoulaye is in her thirties, single with no children, and has her lodgings a few meters from the local IMCEC branch office. She recently opened her account and was just granted her first loan to purchase condiments: onions, potatoes, spices, chickens, that are needed to prepare dishes for her customers.

Ramatoulaye employs two women who assist her in cooking and stays open from 7 am to 11:30 pm. Her expenses are therefore her employees' salaries and small operating expenses.

Her desire is to expand her business and increase her capital to open another restaurant.

loans.use: buy condiments: onions, chickens for food preparations

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has one school-going child. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase cement and sand for construction of a rental house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for construction

loans.name: Devwe Pou Vanse

texts.en: Nadia is a development agent helping poor communities participate in their own economic development. In March 2014, she gathered with members and formed a solidarity group. Thanks to the training received in the Village savings loan associations, she is part of the committee board with multi-background people. Now, they need a loan to buy cosmetics products. Your contribtution will allow this group of 30 people to be connected to a microfinance institution for the first time. The loan will reinforce their financial autonomy while increasing their purchasing power and their profits. Portrayed from left to right: Sherly who is the secretary, Frantz who is the treasurer and Nadia who is the president.

loans.use: to purchase 120 sacks of cosmetic products to sell to consumers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy and resell food products

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Djaba  est la dame qui a les deux mains soulevées sur la photo.                                                                                                          Djaba est une embaucheuse  âgée de 54 ans, qui exerce l’embauche des moutons depuis  10 ans. Elle est mariée à un cultivateur et elle a 5 enfants, âgés de 30 ans à  18 ans dont deux scolarisés .Elle compte toujours  investir  les fonds reçus de RMCR dans l’embauche de moutons chose qui lui réussit depuis plusieurs années. Djaba espère tirer un bénéfice plus conséquent pour aider son  époux à couvrir les charges familiales.   Elle achète ses moutons au marché  local de son village et les revend au grand marché hebdomadaire de sa commune. La difficulté  majore est le prix souvent  très  élevé  des aliments bétails.
texts.en:
Djaba is the woman with her hands open in the photo.  She is 54 years old and has been raising sheep for ten years.  She is married to a farmer and they have five children between the ages of eighteen and thirty, two of their children attend school.

Djaba has been running her business successfully for several years and plans to invest her loan from the field partner, RMCR, in her business.  She hopes to be able to make a larger profit as a result of this, and help her husband provide for the expenses of their family.

Djaba buys sheep at her local, village market, and sells them on at the main weekly market held in her commune.  Her main problem is the often high price of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening up and selling on.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers can eat. She faces the major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients and hence the perishing of goods, which leads to losses.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for coffee, milk, honey, sugar and maintenance of his coffee machine.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has been operating a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces the major challenge of creditors taking a long time to pay for goods taken on credit. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Dieu Devant

texts.en: Nadia (portrayed in the middle) is a local leader who has been contributing to several women in her community when they have a pregnancy. In 2013, she joined two men to form a solidarity group whose members mostly keep thrift shops as their main economic activity. Laurent (on her left) is the secretary and Guyvenson (on her right) is an accountant for the group that closed its cycle of credit two months ago. They now hope to find an additional investment in Zafen for the new cycle.

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Fanm Vanyan Sapotille

texts.en: Duela (left) as the treasurer, Derniecil (middle) as the secretary and Darline (right) as president represent a solidarity group. They have been educating people in the community on credit for three years.They now need more money to buy beauty supplies to sell to their members. 85% of their members are involved in cosmetics sales and they are being supervised by an NGO in the field. Giving them a loan will raise the women's purchasing power as well as their family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new beauty supplies in bulk to sell to customers

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma has been operating her own rental housing business for years, and she earns well from this. She is from Pasay, is 64 years of age, and is a widow. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs. Norma is working hard with the determination to have more income than they currently have.

To improve her profit and to pay for the maintenance of the boarding house, Norma would like to ask for loan assistance. An amount of PHP 13,000 could help her in the renovation and beautification of their place, so that her regular boarders will choose to stay there for a longer period of time. She will also use a portion of the loan to top up the capital needed for her RTW  (ready-to-wear) business. In the future, she hopes that she can have her own stall for her clothing business. 

In advance, Norma sincerely sends you her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance. 

Norma only wishes to be always healthy and efficient in everyday life. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of their rental house.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has been operating a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Luvuno dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking fat oil.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Taufiq

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Taufiq. Taufiq lives in Jember, a city located about four hours by plane from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He owns a stall that mobile airtime credits, mobile phone accessories and provides mobile payment services for his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago. He learned about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wanted to expand his business. 

As the business grows, Taufiq is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Taufiq improve his business and accordingly, his community, who needs access to such services.  Taufiq’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community. As seen in the photo, Taufiq is the one who is standing in his stall. He will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments for members of his local community.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor  tiene la edad  de 45 años, está en unión libre, vive con la esposa . Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicida, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Victor is 45 years old and has a partner, with whom he lives.

Victor plans to use this loan to buy fertilisers and fungicides. He wants to take advantage of the soil’s fertileness and the climate, and other factors that will encourage good coffee beans to grow.

With these improvements to his crops, Victor hopes to earn a little more profit and thus improve his and his family’s quality of life. He also wants to invest more in his work and achieve some goals.

This is Victor’s first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has no other loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided this loan under better conditions and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of wood and bamboo split in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of bamboo and wood.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of wood and bamboo split business for 11 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Josephine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of bamboo and wood

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 63 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Felicidad is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and pay for laborer's salaries to clean the farm.

Felicidad has been farming rice for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling cosmetics products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for laborer's salaries to clean the farm

loans.name: Galo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Galo un hombre luchador de 48 años, mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la cual tienen 2 hijos el mayor de 19 años y la ultima de 9 años , la esposa es empleada en el sector, vive y tiene el negocio en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos un lugar tranquilo de clima cálido húmedo rodeado de gente amable y trabajadora, en este Cantón tradicionalmente se realizan festividades en honor a su cantonización, el mismo muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de su maravillosa cascadas, flora y fauna silvestre 
El señor Galo se dedica al servicio de transporte tiene una camioneta en la que realiza fletes, esto ha sido el sustento de su familia durante varios años, solicita este crédito para invertir en el arreglo del vehículo, con esta inversión podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus cliente y podrá tener más clientes referidos ya que estos son los que ayudan a incrementar  sus ingresos económicos 
El señor Galo agradece a fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad que le están brindando a él y su familia para tener una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Galo is 48 years old and hard-working. He has a strong relationship with his partner, with whom he has two children. The eldest is 19 years old and the youngest is nine. Galo’s partner works in the local area. Galo lives and has his business in the San Miguel de los Bancos canton, a quiet area with a warm, humid climate. Here the people are friendly and hard-working. There are traditional festivals for the canton that many foreign and domestic tourists attend. They enjoy the marvellous waterfalls and the wild flora and fauna that the local area has to offer.		

Galo makes a living providing transport services. He has a van that he uses for transporting goods. This work has allowed Galo to support his family for a number of years. Today he is applying for a loan in order to maintain his van and offer better service. He will then have more referred customers, which will help him to increase his income.

Galo is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and opportunity that they are providing to him and his family in order to have a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain the van that he uses for transporting goods.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanahawa operates a grocery stall selling vegetables, and she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs to her place of operation. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with six kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mariam operates a vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.
 
With the Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: A 55 ans, Kossiwa est une femme veuve et avec ses quatre enfants elle vit dans le quartier d’Agoè. Restauratrice, Kossiwa est une revendeuse de pate bandée et s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Kossiwa réalise une très bonne rentabilité avec son activité génératrice de revenu. Kossiwa nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de maïs afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is a 55-year-old widow with four children.  They live in the Agoè district.  Kossiwa sells maize mash and is very successful.  She buys her supplies four times a month from the market.

Kossiwa needs this loan to buy sacks of maize in order to increase her profits and be able to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Ekoinafou

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 25 ans, Ekoinafou est une femme qui vit à Kpogan avec ses trois enfants. Devant son domicile, Ekoinafou vend du riz préparé à ses clients et trouve son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Ekoinafou s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Ekoinafou demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de riz et réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ekoinafou is 25 years old, married and lives in Kpogan with her three children.  She earns a living by selling prepared rice from the front of her house.  In order to efficiently maintain her stock levels, she buys new supplies twice a month.

Ekoinafou has requested this loan to buy further sacks of rice, increase her profit levels and help her husband provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of rice for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Jigisemse Group

texts.fr:
Sédiè est celle qui a la main gauche posée  sur le  mouton.
Sédiè est Malienne, âgée  de 39 ans, exerçante l’embouche de moutons depuis 5 ans. Mariée à un  paysan elle a 4 enfants, âgés de 20 ans à 13 ans dont  03 sont  scolarisés. Elle achète  ses  moutons au marché local de son village pour les revendre au marché urbain ce qui lui permet d’en tirer un bénéfice plus conséquent  lors des ventes. Sédiè veut subvenir  aux besoins de ses enfants avec les bénéfices  qu’elle obtiendra, notamment  sur le plan de la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité. Elle aide son mari qui n’a pas assez de moyen pour satisfaire à tous les besoins de la famille. Sédiè est une femme courageuse et engagée dans son travail d’embouche. Le problème de sécheresse est la difficulté majore qui peut souvent arriver.
texts.en:
Sédiè is seen in the photo with her hand on a sheep.  She is Malian, 39 years old, married to a farmer and has four children.  Her children are aged between thirteen and twenty years.  Three of her children currently attend school.

Sédiè has been buying and selling sheep for five years.  She buys the sheep at the local village market, and resells them in town.  This helps her to improve her profit levels.  

Sédiè wants to meet the needs of her children, notably for food, healthcare and schooling. She helps her husband with these costs as he is unable to support all the family's needs.

The main problem that Sédiè faces is drought but she is a courageous woman who works hard at her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Nguyệt

texts.en:
Mrs Nguyệt works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

She is 52 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nguyệt's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nguyệt has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nguyệt faces in her life is not having money to build a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Nguyệt hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr: Ayawavi est une femme mariée de 37 ans et habite à Agoè avec sa famille. Ayawavi est une mère qui a deux enfants à sa  charge et vend des  tissus basins pour avoir un revenu permettant de favoriser leur épanouissement. Grace à ce commerce, Ayawavi gagne son revenu et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Pour acheter des pièces de basins, Ayawavi sollicite ce prêt pour réaliser ses objectifs et aider son mari pour couvrir les charges de ses enfants grâce à son bénéfice.
texts.en:
Ayawavi is 37 years old, married and lives in Agoè with her family.  She has two children and sells damask fabric to generate an income to support them.  She buys new supplies three times a month from suppliers.

Ayawavi has requested this loan to buy more fabric, achieve her aims and help her husband provide for the expenses of their children.

loans.use: to buy 4 pieces of damask fabric for resale.

loans.name: Pyalo

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée Pyalo vit à Klévé avec ses trois enfants. Pyalo est âgée de 41 ans et est très active pour la prospérité de sa famille. Ainsi pour contribuer à la survie de son foyer, Pyalo vend de la boule de pate préparée à base du maïs. Pyalo alimente particulièrement des élèves dans un établissement scolaire afin de réaliser ses gains. Pyalo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander un sac de maïs et du soja, Pyalo nécessite ce crédit pour faire ses achats afin d’avoir un bénéfice pour investir dans la vie éducative de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Pyalo is 41 years old, married and lives in Klévé with her three children.  She works very hard to improve the prosperity of her family.  To do this, she prepares and sells maize mash.  She sells most of her food to school children.

Twice a month Pyalo buys more supplies from the market.  She has requested this loan so she can buy one sack of maize and one sack of soya.  She hopes this will generate a profit which she can invest in the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of maize and 1 sack of soya for resale.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. Elsa is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elsa requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more household goods to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Chita

texts.en:
Ma. Chita is 47 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming ornamental plants in the Philippines. Ma. Chita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers, flower pots, a variety of plants, etc.

Ma. Chita has been farming ornamental plants for 15 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers, flower pots, and a variety of plants

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 32 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling of Avon products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of Avon products to sell.

Gina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling of Avon products business for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, six of whom are in school, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Vilma is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional baskets of fish to make dried fish for her dried fish-making business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mely works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish. Mely is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Mely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Judy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and charcoal retail. Judy is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional stock to sell like milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Judy has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 30 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Emelyn has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Emelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and earns additional income from tailoring. Elisa is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Myra works hard to support her family.

She has a beauty salon business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Myra is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of material for her beauty salon business.

Myra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of material for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Edelyn works hard to support her family.
,
She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Edelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Edelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Julieta works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of dried fish business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling vegetables. Julieta is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her buy and sell of dried fish business.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 55 years old and widowed with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Estela has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and charcoal.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming rice for 15 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jaina

texts.en:
Jaina is 48 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jaina is borrowing 13,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase an additional variety of seeds and other farm supplies.

Jaina has been farming vegetables for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional variety of seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita works hard to support her family. Rita is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a 16,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

Rita has been in this business for four years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Mira works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Mira is borrowing 15,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to  purchase materials like paints, wood, bamboo, and other items for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mira has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like paints, wood, bamboo, and other items

loans.name: Annette

texts.en:
Annette is 52 years old with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Annette runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Annette has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Annette would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish for her making dried fish business.

Nida has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Joebima

texts.en:
Joebima is 48 years old and married with three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Joebima has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Wassa Wassa 2 Group

texts.fr: Wassa Wassa 2 fait partie des premiers clients de notre institution et regroupe 7 femmes travailleuses. Ce groupe a contracté le crédit plus de 20 fois et a toujours fait les remboursements à bonne date. Mena est le membre représentatif de ce groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont un fille mariée et les autres sont toujours à l'école. Elle vend des céréales et elle a besoin de ce crédit pour renforcer ce commerce. Avec son revenu, elle arrive à contribuer pour les dépenses de sa famille. Les bénéfices issues de ses ventes lui permettront de pourvoir à ses propres besoins, d'aider dans la gestion familiale et de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
The 'Wassa Wassa 2' Group was among the first clients of the field partner.  It is made up of seven working women.  The women have had more than twenty loans and have always repaid fully and on time.

Mena is the group representative.  She is married and has four children, one of her daughters is now married and the others still attend school.  Mena sells cereals.  She needs this loan to reinforce her business.  She contributes to the expenses of her family, thanks to her income.  Her profits are used to pay her personal expenses, help provide for the family and continue her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals (maize, beans and millet) for resale.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, tiene una venta de hamburguesas y hot dogs, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo de 24 años de edad y su nuera, su negocio lo inicio por cuenta propia y por la necesidad de cubrir sus gastos familiares, con las ganancias que generaba pudo comprar su coche para elaborar la venta, su horario de trabajo es de nueve de la mañana a tres de la tarde y el puesto lo tiene ubicado en una para de autobuses, su dificultad para trabajar se da en la época de invierno.
Comprará embutidos, bebidas, lechugas, tomates, aderezos, cebollas, carnes y otros materiales para tener surtido el negocio y mantener su continuidad. Espera poder incrementar las ventas, atender mejor a sus clientes y no tener problemas para trabajar.
Sus proyectos son salir adelante junto a su familia y realizar la compra de otro coche para elaborar la venta de hamburguesas y hot dogs en otro punto de la cuidad, con ayuda de un empleado.
texts.en:
Teresa has a stall selling hamburgers and hot dogs. She is a single mother and lives with her 24 year-old son and her daughter in law. She started up her business by herself because she needed to cover her family's expenses. With what she was earning she was able to buy a car from which she sells her food. She works from nine in the morning to three in the afternoon. Her stall  is located in a bus stop. She finds it difficult to work over winter.

With the loan she will buy cold meats, drinks, lettuce, tomatoes, seasoning, onions, meat and other products to stock her business and maintain its continuity. She hopes to be able to increase her sales, better provide for her customers’ needs and not have any problems with her work. She aims to progress along with her family and buy another car in order to, with the help of an employee, run another stall selling hamburgers and hot dogs at another location in the city.

loans.use: to buy cold meats, drinks, lettuce, tomatoes, seasoning, onions, meat and other products to stock her business and maintain its continuity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs such as rice, oil, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Maria Reyna

texts.es: Maria es una mujer luchadora de 41 años de edad quien se dedica al trabajo de campo para dar sustento a su familia la cual está compuesta por 4 hijos quienes estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Ella cuenta con un grado de educación primario completo que pudo cursar gracias al apoyo de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a cultivar maíz y frijol ya hace algunos años. Actualmente ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz en compañía de su pareja la cual es su único apoyo en un terreno que es propio gracias a una herencia de sus padres. Los clientes para su producto ya procesado son las diferentes bodegas y pulperías en otros municipios fuera de donde ella habita. Actualmente ella necesita crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares y plaguicidas para poder dar asistencia a sus cultivos ya que en unos pocos meses su cosecha dará los resultados y necesita proteger de plagas para obtener un excelente ingreso. Su sueño son como toda madre apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y proveerles un mejor futuro para que ellos pueda graduarse de una carrera de provecho y que tengan mejores oportunidades en su vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 41, is a determined woman who works as a farmer to support her family consisting of four children who attend the community school.  She finished her primary education thanks to the support of her parents.  They were they ones who taught her to grow corn and beans some years ago.  Now she and her partner grow corn on their own land that she inherited from her parents.  The customers who buy her produce are warehouses and stores in other towns. 

Maria is in need of a loan to buy fertilizers, manure, leaf treatment and insecticides for her crop because soon it will be harvest time and she must protect the crop from disease in order to obtain an optimum income.

Her dream, like every mother, is to support her children in their studies and give them a better future so they can earn a degree and enjoy better opportunities in life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, leaf treatment and insecticides for her corn crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tule (bulrush) to increase mat production.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es una mujer de 33 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 1 año y una hija mujer de 5 años, y su negocio es la confección de guantes de cuero.
Ella es buena madre, comprometida con su trabajo de buen trato, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en un tambo de frutas en la zona sur de la ciudad, donde lado a lado conviven; empresas, restaurantes, departamentos familiares, universidades y todo tipo de comercios, de clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-26 grados centígrados.
Marcela es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, complexión física delgada, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza junto a sus hijos; el mayor está iniciando la escuela y la menor aún no está en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento y cuenta con agua de pozo y energía electrica. Su negocio es la confección de guantes de cuero para todo tipo de actividad, como; construcción, jardinería, y todo trabajo donde las manos necesiten protección. “inicie mi negocio con la ayuda de mi padre, actualmente los 2 nos ocupamos e la confección…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su propia empresa de confecciones en cuero, ella desea realizar la compra de variedades de cuero para confeccionar guantes y otros accesorios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad de manera continua.
Es por esos motivos que Marcela solicita un préstamo para la compra de cuero para confeccionar guantes para pagar los gastos escolares de su hijo mayor.
texts.en:
Marcela, 33, is single and has a one-year-old son and a five-year-old daughter.  She makes leather gloves for a living.  She is a good mother, committed to her work and is kind, responsible and hard-working.  She works at a fruit market area in the sourthern part of her city, where there are several companies, restaurants, family shops, universities and all kinds of commercial businesses sharing the space.  The local climate is warm with an average temperature of between 18-26 degrees Celsius.

Marcela has a dark complexion, long black hair that she ties back, dark eyes, a thin figure, short height, and her mother tongue is Quechua which is spoken locally.  She speaks Spanish for general cultural purposes and for her business.  She lives with her children, the eldest of whom attends school and the youngest is still too young.  She lives in her own family house built of brick and concrete, which has well water and electricity.

Her business is making leather gloves for all types of activities, such as construction, gardening and any work requiring protection for the hands.  "I started my business with the help of my father; we both work in this activity..." she says.  Her dream is to establish her own leather goods company.  She wants to buy a variety of leathers for gloves and other accessories.  This is her first loan through the institution in the four years she has been in this business.

Marcela is requesting a loan to buy leather to make gloves to pay for her eldest child's school expenses.

loans.use: To buy leather to make gloves and pay for her eldest child's school expenses.

loans.name: Munezerwe Group

texts.fr:
Générose  fait partie du groupe  Munezerwe et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est une  veuve de 2 enfants  l’un a 14 ans et l’autre  à 24 ans, tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  riz, haricot, tomate,....  depuis  15 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  riz et  de haricot à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  importer des pagnes de l’extérieur du Burundi et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Générose is part of the group Munezerwe and lives in Bajumbura.  She is a widow with two children, one is 14 and the other is 24 and both are in school.  

She has been selling rice, beans, tomatoes and other food items for 15 years.  

She is on her second loan from Turame.  With her kiva loan, she will add to her savings and buy a large quantity of rice and beans to resell and earn more.  

In the coming years, she wants to import fabrics from outside of Burundi and see her children go to school.

loans.use: to add to her savings and to buy a large quantity of rice and beans to resell and earn more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, and shoes.

loans.name: Bilma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Bilma madre de familia dedicada con amor y esmero a sus 3 hijos de las edades entre 1 y 6 años, para que no les falte nada, esta linda familia vive en un lugar llamada Suchitepéquez.
Para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa, Bilma vende tortillas con carne en una plaza de su comunidad desde hace 2 años, gracias a este pequeño negocio  han logrado sobrevivir con su familia, ella ahora ha pesado en mejorar su casa, realizando una fundición de torta de cemento que funcionara como piso de su casa, pues ellos ahora cuentan con piso de tierra, que hasta en cierto momento provoca polvo y enfermedades para sus hijos, pero una de las limitaciones de Bilma es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar sus materiales, entonces  ahora Bilma a tomado la decisión de realizar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, cal, arena para colocar piso de cemento en su casa.
El gran deseo de Bilma es que su casa tenga una mejor presentación, y poder construir algún día una casa de block, pues ellos ahora solo cuentan con una casa de láminas.
texts.en:
Bilma is a loving mother who is dedicated to her three children, ages one through six; so they lack for nothing.  This beautiful family lives in a place called Suchitepequez.

To help her husband with the household income, Bilma sells meat tortillas in a community square where she has worked for two years.  Thanks to her small business the family has been able to get ahead.  Now she has thought about improving the home by installing a concrete floor.  They currently have a dirt floor which causes illness in the children.  She will use the loan to buy cement, lime and sand for the concrete floor.

Bilma's greatest desire is for her home to be more presentable.  One day she would like to build a block house since the one they currently have is of metal sheeting.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and lime for a concrete floor in her home.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Anastacio, de 68 años de edad, no estudio pues sus padres murieron cuando estaba pequeño y tuvo que trabajar junto a sus hermanos, para salir adelante, está soltero y no tiene hijos, pero crió a 6 sobrinos que ahora ya son adultos, cuatro de ellos están fuera del país, pero siempre están pendiente de Anastacio.

Anastacio, ha trabajado desde siempre en los diferentes trabajos de la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y maicillo) y además siempre trabajo en la elaboración de hamacas de henequén (mezcal), ademas ha trabajado en la crianza de especies menores (cerdos y aves de corral).

Desde hace once años trabaja de ayudante de albañil y hace diferentes trabajos en el hogar, de donde el obtiene ingresos económicos, para el sostén de él y de su familia.

Anastacio, solicita un crédito para comprar lámina, cedazo, arena, cemento, bloque  y caños para hacer una galera para crecer pollos de engorde, quiere iniciar una pequeña granja.

Anastacio, sueña ir ademas mejorando su vivienda, el crédito le ayudara para emprender una actividad productiva que le permita, ademas estar pendiente y mantenerse siempre trabajando.
texts.en:
Anastacio, 68 years old, didn't go to school because his parents died when he was young and he had to work with his siblings to get ahead. He is single and doesn't have any children, but he raised 6 nephews and nieces who are now adults. Four of them are out of the country, but they are in close contact with Anastacio.

Anastacio has always worked in different agricultural jobs (growing corn, beans, and sorghum) and in addition, he has always worked making hammocks from henequen (agave). He has also worked raising small animals (pigs and poultry).

For the past eleven years, he has worked as an assistant bricklayer and does different jobs in the home where he gets income to support himself and his family.

Anastacio asks for a loan to purchase metal sheeting, mesh, sand, cement, concrete blocks, and pipes to make a shed to raise chickens for fattening; he wants to start a small farm. 

Anastacio dreams of making additional improvements to his house. The loan will help him to undertake the work that allows this, in addition to being ready and keep himself always working.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting, mesh, sand, cement, concrete blocks, and pipes to make a shed to raise chickens for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sheep to resell after they have fattened

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Carolina is 56 years old now.

Carolina has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Carolina requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business like thread, garments, etc.

Carolina has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Carolina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business like thread and garments.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy materials like bamboo, wood, etc, for maintenance of her fishing boat business.

Alona has been in this business for 2 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo, wood, etc, for maintenance of her boat.

loans.name: María Emerita

texts.es:
Emerita, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casada y tiene dos hijos, los cuales van a la escuela.

Emerita, se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas, está actividad la realiza desde hace varios años y la aprendió de su padre.- Emerita, elabora Hamacas por encargo y elabora una por semana, para venderlas en la comunidad.

Este préstamo será para comprar hilo de diferentes colores, para elaboración de hamaca, de lo cual espera obtener beneficios económicos en el corto plazo o a final del mes.

El deseo de Emerita, es poner todo su esfuerzo para que sus hijos tengan una buena educación; además, espera ampliar un poco más la elaboración de sus productos y generar mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Emerita is 36 years old and studied until the seventh grade. She is married and has two children, who both attend school.

Emerita makes a living making hammocks. She has been doing this activity for several years and learned it from her father. Emerita develops and produces one custom made hammock per week to sell in the community.

This loan will be used to buy yarn of different colors to make hammocks, from which she hopes to obtain economic benefits in the short term or at the end of the month.

Emerita's dream is to put all of her efforts so that her children have a good education, and furthermore she hopes to expand the development of her products and generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy yarn of different colors to make a hammock.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Charlita is 52 years old and has one child in school.

Charlita has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Charlita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of bananas to sell on her food stall.

Charlita has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Charlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of bananas to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 62 years old and married with five children. Cresencia works very hard to provide for them.

Cresencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell in her general store like rice, soap and other groceries.

Cresencia has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Cresencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy item to sell in her general store like rice, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia works hard to support her family. Nelia is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of noodles, cream, spices, vegetables, etc.

Nelia has been in this business for 11 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of noodles, cream, spices, vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to add to her savings and buy a large quantity of amaranth grain to resell and gain more

loans.name: Grupo Patzite Centro Las Marias Group

texts.es:
Maria (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) es una muchacha de 41 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad denominada Nahualá.
Maria es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, que trabaja día a día para darle lo mejor a su familia, ella para obtener sus ingresos cuenta con una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes dese hace 7 años la tienda se encuentra ubicada en su casa es por eso que también se dedica a la venta de ropa típica, ella ahora ha pensado en incrementar su pequeña tienda, pero para hacerlo se necesita de una buena cantidad de dinero, Maria para alcanzar su meta a organizado a un grupo de señoras con el mismo objetivo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar más mercaderías como: Arroz, aceite, azúcar, recitos y  gaseosas.
María sueña con que su negocio se mas grande para que pueda satisfacer las necesidades de la comunidad.
texts.en:
María (the first on the left in the photo) is a 41 year old woman. She lives with her parents in a community named Nahualá.

María is a hard-working and responsible woman who works day to day to give her family the best. To get her income, she has had a small grocery store for the past 7 years. The store is located in her house and, for this reason, she also works selling traditional clothing. She is now thinking of expanding her small store, but to do so, she needs a good amount of money. María, to achieve her goal, has organized a group of women with the same goal to ask for a loan that will be used to purchase more merchandise such as rice, oil, sugar, Ricitos snacks, and soft drinks.

María dreams that her business will be bigger to be able to satisfy the community's needs.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store such as rice, oil, sugar, Ricitos snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria es una mujer de 40 años de edad quien se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como ser maíz y frijol. Su grado de estudio es de primaria el completo gracias al apoyo de sus padres quienes también le enseñaron a trabajar a temprana edad para que ella con el tiempo se pudiera defender. Ella es madre soltera de 4 hijos quienes estudian en la escuela de la comunidad y apoyan al salir de sus actividades escolares a su madre en el campo. El mercado de venta para su producto es en las diferentes comunidades cercanas al igual que a través de las bodegas e intermediarios que llegan a la zona. Actualmente ella solicita crédito a COMIXMUL para la compra de semilla certificada de maíz y frijol y los diferentes insumos que ayudaran a proteger la semilla una vez cultivada. Su meta poder con el tiempo comprar una parcela de tierra más la cual le permita cultivar y expandir sus cultivos para generar más ingresos y apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios de manera propia ya que el trabajo es duro y pesado y en ocasiones arriesgado por algunos así como también llevar a cabo mejoras en su vivienda las cuales son necesarias para que esta este mejor acondicionada para su familia
texts.en: Maria is a 40 year old woman who works growing basic grains of corn and bean. She studied up to elementary school thanks to her parents' support who also taught her to work at an early age so she could support herself. She is the single mother of 4 children who attend school in their community and help their mother in the field after they finish their school day.  She sells her product at the different neighboring communities, as well as at the stores and to intermediaries who arrive in her area. Currently, she is requesting a loan to COMIXMUL to buy certified seed of corn and bean, and the different inputs that will protect the seed once it is cultivated. Her goal is to be able to buy another parcel of land in time, so that she can cultivate and expand her crops in order to generate more income and support her children with their studies so they can be independent, because the work is hard and heavy and sometimes risky. She would also like to carry out improvements to her house which are necessary so it is better conditioned for her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and corn and bean seed to grow.

loans.name: Grupo Sector Campo Aldea Madremia Group

texts.es:
Jacqueline es una mujer casada de 20 años de edad, tiene un hijo que estudia en la escuela de su comunidad llamada Aldea madremia.
Jacqueline(la primera del lado derecho de camiseta negra) para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa desde hace 3 años en la plaza de su comunidad, gracias a este negocio ha logrado mantener a su familia, pero ahora Jacqueline ha pensado en incrementar su negocio de ropa, pero para hacerlo ella necesita de una buena cantidad de dinero, por lo que se ha unido a un grupo de señoras con el mismo propósito para solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá comprando más ropas de estilos modernos y de colores nuevos, para satisfacer mejor a la clientela. 
Jacqueline sueña poder contar algún día con un local donde pueda exhibir mejor su mercadería y así poder mejorar sus ingresos
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a married woman, 20 years old, and has a son who goes to school in her community, called Madremia village. 

Jacqueline (the first on the right with the black shirt), to earn income and support her family, has worked buying and selling clothing for the past 3 years in her community's plaza. Thanks to this business, she has managed to support her family, but now Jacqueline has thought of increasing her clothing business, but to be able to do so, she needs a good amount of money, so she has gathered a group of women with the same goal to ask for a loan that will be invested in purchasing more clothing in modern styles and new colors to better satisfy her customers.

Jacqueline dreams of being able to one day have a retail space where she can better display her merchandise and in this way increase her income.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothes.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro tiene 36 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su conyugue y sus 3 menores hijos de edades 14, 11 y 6 años en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 4 años y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. Esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto y obtendrá mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Genaro is 36 years old and lives in his own house, made from rudimentary materials, with his wife and their three young children, aged 14, 11 and 6. They live in Pomahuaca district, in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú. Life is tranquil in this district, and the inhabitants work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.  

Genaro makes a living farming, specifically in the cultivation of coffee. He has 4 years experience in this field, and he has good personal and working references from his neighbours. The loan that he has been granted will be used for agricultural work, the use and incorporation of phytosanitary products, pesticides and labour for his harvest. The loan will help him to improve the physiology, morphology and productivity of his crops, resulting in a good harvest. Owing to these improvements, he will not have trouble selling his products, and he will earn a higher income, which will allow him to improve his quality of life, and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase phytosanitary products, pesticides and labour for his harvest.

loans.name: Delaila

texts.en:
Delaila is 42 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Delaila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, snack food and other groceries. She has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Delaila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, snack food and other groceries

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.en:
Eduarda is 59 years old with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Eduarda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries. She has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Eduarda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like spices, vegetables, meat, etc., for her food vending business. Rosalinda has been in this business for 20 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like spices, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Ferney Roberto

texts.es:
Ferney es un creativo hombre de 33 años de edad que con una buena idea logro crear un negocio para generar el sustento de su hija de años de edad y su pequeño de tan solo 1 mes de edad y claro de su pareja.
Él vive en una zona donde prima negocios como la agricultura y la cría de animales, en su zona hace mucho calor y de repente se le ocurrió montar en la zona trasera de su casa una venta de helados, se llevó con la gran sorpresa que su negocio gusto en su zona y ahora se convirtió en su medio de sostenimiento y piensa seguir trabajando para lograr un sueño que es construir una heladería tal y como la que se encuentra en la ciudad.
Pensando en cumplir su sueño Ferney quiere solicitar un préstamo que invertirá de la siguiente forma:
•	Comprar un enfriador
•	Surtido de helados de diferentes sabores
•	E iniciar a realizar adecuaciones al negocio, este es un proyecto en el que trabajara todo el año, como se puede ver en la foto es un hogar de madera y con tiempo y dinero lo modificara hasta lograr el sueño de tener una heladería como la que se ven en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Ferney is a creative man who is 33 years of age. He came up with a good idea of creating a business so that he could generate income to support his daughter, his one-month-old son, and of course, his partner.

Ferney lives in an area where the main businesses are agriculture and raising animals. The area where he lives is very hot and it occurred to him while traveling in the neighborhood that he could sell ice cream from the back of his house. It was a great surprise that his business was well-liked in the area and now it has become his source of income. He plans to continue working so that he can achieve his dream of building an ice cream shop in the city.

Ferney is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the following: the purchase of a freezer, a stock of ice cream in different flavors, and the start of renovations to his business. The work on the renovation project will take the entire year. As indicated in the photo, his home is made of wood, so it will take time and money to make the modifications needed to reach his goal of having an ice cream shop that can be seen from the city.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer, a stock of ice cream, and to make renovations to his business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 57 years old, married, and has four children. Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now. 

Marissa requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like mineral water, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

In the future, Marissa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like mineral water, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Alexi Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela, de 32 años de edad, no pudo estudiar, está acompañada y su pareja realiza labores agrícolas, como cultivo de maíz y frijol y tienen 2 hijos, los cuales asisten a la escuela.

Maricela, se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino y otras especies animales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años, junto con su compañero de vida quien fue la persona que le enseño a realizarlas.

Maricela, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos pecuarios que le servirán para el cuido de sus animales, tales como concentrados, harinillas y medicinas etc.- Estos insumos servirán para hacer crecer sus animales y dentro de poco tiempo poder venderlos a un buen precio.

El anhelo más grande de Maricela, es que algún día sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales, por medio de una buena educación, la cual espera que con sus esfuerzos y sacrificios lo logrará.
texts.en:
Maricela is 32 years old and was not able to go to school. She is married and her husband does agricultural labor, such as the cultivations of corn and beans. They have two children who both attend school.

Maricela makes a living in the raising of cattle and other animal species. She has been doing this activity for several years, together with her life partner who was the one who taught her how to do it.

Maricela needs a loan to buy livestock inputs that will serve to care for the animals, such as concentrates, middlings, and medicines, etc. These inputs will serve to raise the animals and in little time she will sell them at a good price.

Maricela's greatest desire is that one day her children will become professionals, through a good education, which she hopes will succeed with her efforts and sacrifices.

loans.use: to buy livestock inputs such as concentrates, middlings, and medicines, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia Rosa

texts.es:
Cecilia es una mujer perseverante, trabajadora que aprovecha sus habilidades para poder generar ingresos, ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos como lo son almuerzo, desayunos, pasa bocas, productos fritos, dicha actividad la inicio por necesidad pues se separó de su esposo quedando como cabeza de familia, ella es madre de 3 hijos ellos son adolescentes.

Cecilia adopto esta actividad pues tenía un talento empírico en la elaboración de alimentos, ella no podía aspirar a un trabajo pues no contaba con mucha experiencia y aparte siempre fue ama de casa dedicada de lleno a la crianza de sus hijos.

Cecilia se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos, su idea es comprar arroz, aceite, carnes, café, frutas para realizar jugos, pastas, lentejas, frijoles, salsas para darle sabor a sus productos, especias, cubiertos, refrescos entre otros.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a persistent and hardworking woman who takes advantage of her skills to generate an income. She has made a living in the sale of food such as breakfast, lunch, snacks, and fried products. She began this activity out of necessity since she separated from her husband who was the head of the family. She is the mother of three children who are adolescents. 

Cecilia adopted this activity because she has an empirical talent in making food. She could not aspire to a job because she did not have much experience and apart from that, she was always a housewife who was dedicated to raising her children.

Cecilia is asking for a loan which she will invest to buy raw materials to make her products. Her idea is to buy rice, oil, meat, coffee, fruits to make juices, pasta, lentils, beans, sauces to give flavor to her foods, spices, cutlery, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of products to make her dishes (such as rice, oil, meat, coffee, and fruit to make juices).

loans.name: Jose Leonardo

texts.es:
Jose tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Colasay que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente y sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, realiza esta actividad desde hace 6 años y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto Jose espera ofrecer un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in the District of Colasay in Jaén Province. This area lies in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in this district goes about peacefully and the residents work in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding.

Jose grow coffee and has been in this business for six years. He has good personal and work-related references from his neighbors. His loan will be used to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can maintain his coffee crop. With this loan, Jose hopes to offer a product of better quality to his customers. This will have a positive impact on his income level, which will eventually improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Segundo Pedro

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 38 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus 5 menores hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 6 años por lo que cuenta con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. Esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le permitirán tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo is 38 years old, and lives in his own rustic house with his wife and their five small children in the Pomahuaca district. This is located in the Jaén province of the Cajamarco region in the northern mountains of Perú.  The main activities carried out in this district are agriculture, commerce, and raising animals.

Segundo makes a living in agriculture, specifically by growing coffee plants.  He has six years of experience in this field; therefore, he has regular customers who give very good personal and work references for him.  

The loan that will be granted to Segundo will be used in his agricultural work to add and apply pesticides, to purchase fertilizers, and to pay for labor for the harvest.  This will help him improve his crops both physiologically and morphologically, as well as improve their productivity.  It will also help him get a timely harvest.  He will have greater production and a higher quality product; thus, he will not have difficulty selling his coffee plants.  This will generate a greater income that will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to add and apply pesticides, to purchase fertilizers, and to pay for labor for the harvest.

loans.name: Cesar Enrique

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 42 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de jornalería y de fumigación en los diferentes cultivos de su distrito y zonas cercanas, contando con herramientas propias como mochila de fumigar, también cuenta con una moto lineal la cual le sirve para transportarse y así poder realizar sus labores de la mejor manera. Tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y sus clientes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo será para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a sus herramientas y equipos diversos ya que se encuentran en mal estado, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas lo que tendrá una gran influencia en el negocio, con esto Cesar espera mejorar la productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar is 42 years old, single, and doesn't have children. He lives with his family in a rural zone in Oyotún district, which is located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.
