texts.es: MARTHA: Es una mujer luchadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas de la etnia miskita, tiene 44 años de edad, casada con un hijo de 15 años que estudia su 4to año de la secundaria. Desde  hace 3 años no cambia la madera de su vivienda construida de madera y de tambo, que actualmente necesita reparación.  Es por eso que solicita su primer préstamo para cambiar madera rústica, madera cepillada, postes de madera, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella y su marido sueñan con tener una casa de concreto que tenga mejores condiciones para sus hijos y sobre todo mayor seguridad
texts.en:
Martha is a strong woman. She comes from Puerto Cabezas and she belongs to the Mistika ethnic group. Martha is married with a 15 year old son who is studying in the fourth year of secondary school. 

Martha's tambo home hasn't had the wood upgraded for more than three years, and it is in need of immediate repairs.  

For this reason, Martha is asking for a loan to buy rough wood, brushed wood, wooden posts and nails, and also to cover labor costs.

Martha and her husband dream of having a home made of concrete which would provide better living conditions for her children and above all, better security.

loans.use: to upgrade the wood on her 'tambo' (builiding on stilts) home.

loans.name: Teratai Indah Group

texts.en:
Teratai Indah Group proposed a loan to support their businesses in pigs and farming. Now, after six months maintaining both businesses, they have achieved a satisfactory profit. They sold the pigs to the big buyer. Sayu Komang sold her pig and her paddys. The price for one kilogram from the paddy is 3.00 IDR. Sayu Komang is very happy with the result. Now she can support her family's needs. All the members of Teratai Indah Group earn a satisfactory profit. They can set aside for saving. One member continued her business with her savings and decided to resign. She thanks all lenders, Kiva and MUK.

Resuming the loan now, Teratai Indah Group will use it for farming only. The pigs business will still continue with their own savings as capital. They will plant paddy, rent a tractor and buy fertilizer. Sayu Komang will use her portion of the loan to purchase paddy seed, rent for a tractor and buy fertilizer. This month is rainy season, the right time to go to the rice field. Sayu Komang hopes for the best. She will save all the profit and use it for supporting capital for her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase paddy seed, rent a tractor and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Isau Augusto

texts.es:
Isau, de 32 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, está acompañado y su pareja le ayuda en el trabajo de la agricultura, tiene un hijo que estudia en la escuela del cantón. 

Isau, trabaja la agricultura y la ganadería desde temprana edad, ya que lo aprendió de su padre y hermano.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar maíz.

Isau, sueña con hacer siembras más grandes, para cosechar más y obtener mejores ingresos para darle una mejor calidad vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Isau is 32 years old and studied through the 6th grade of his basic education. He is in a relationship, his partner helps him with farm work and he has a son who goes to the canton school. Isau works in agriculture and with cattle since he was very young, he learned from his father and his brother. 

He will use the loan to buy farming supplies to grow corn.  Isau dreams of having bigger crops to harvest and that way obtain better revenue to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to grow corn.

loans.name: Jovilyn

texts.en:
Jovilyn is 44 years old, married and has three children. Jovilyn and her husband manage a business for the repairing of vehicles. Her husband also engages in buying and selling used cars. 

They experienced lots of reasons to give up, but they did not lose their hope to rise. Jovilyn has managed the business for 11 years, and she is happy because up to the present, she is still managing and gradually improving the business. 

Jovilyn wishes to respond immediately to their customers to satisfy them, and gain more customers to serve. For this purpose, she wanted a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy tools and materials for the vehicle repair business. She hopes for continued growth of their business for the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials for her vehicle repair business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 41 years old and married with two children. With her children currently in school, Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soft drinks, beer, canned goods, snack foods, candy, and coffee to sell in her store.

Rosita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items including those listed above and more. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like soft drinks, beer, canned goods, snack foods, candy, and coffee

loans.name: Gulkaiyr

texts.ru: Гулкайыр 41 год, замужем, есть 2 дтей. Образование среднее. 18 лет назад она начала заниматься сельским хозяйством - животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 10 овец. На участке мерою 1,50 Га собственной и 0,50 Га арендованной земли она выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячная прибыль Гулкайыр составляет около 7,300 сом (KGS). Она решила развить свою сельскохозяйственную деятельность и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели. Доходы от бизнеса Гулкайыр будет вкладывать в дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en:
Gulkaiyr is 41, married, and has two children.  She has a secondary school education and started working in agriculture 18 years ago as a crop and livestock farmer.  She has 3 cows and 10 sheep on her farm, and grows barley on 1.50 hectares of her own land and 0.50 hectares of rented land.  Her monthly profit is 7,300 som.  

Gulkaiyr has decided to develop her agricultural business and has requested a loan of 20,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy a heifer.  She plans on putting the extra income from her business towards its future development.

loans.use: buy a heifer to invest in her business

loans.name: Gelena

texts.en:
Gelena is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gelena is 49 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Gelena has a fishing business in the Philippines. Gelena requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other materials for her business.

Gelena has been in this business for five years. In the future, Gelena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Conchita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Conchita is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gina is 46 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Gina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Gina requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gasoline for her business.

Gina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 33 years old and married with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marissa has a general store business in the Philippines. Marissa requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Ericka Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El sueño de Ericka, es convertir su pulpería en miscelánea, por ello cada día se esfuerza por ofrecer los mejores y variados productos que sus clientes demandan.  Son más de 10 años que tiene de dedicarse a este negocio y confiesa que cada año la demanda aumenta, hasta el punto de convertirse en la pulpera más popular de su zona. 
Ericka sabe aprovechar todas las oportunidades de negocio que se le presentan, por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de productos escolares, pues actualmente están en la temporada más alta. Además, el financiamiento le será de ayuda para adquirir granos básicos e invertir en la compra de ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Ericka's dream is to convert her small grocery store into a general store.  Each day she strives to offer the best and most varied products that her customers demand.  It has been over 10 years that she has dedicated herself to this business and she confesses that every year the demand increases, to the point of becoming the most popular small grocery store in her zone.

Ericka knows how to take advantage of business opportunities that present themselves so she requests a loan to purchase school products as they are currently in high season.  Also, the financing will help to acquire basic grains and to invert in the purchase of clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase school products.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José, de 65 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañado y su pareja está pensionada y tiene 35 años de edad, no tienen hijos.

José, trabaja como albañil, transportista y también trabaja en estructuras metálicas, siempre ha trabajado en albañilería, pero hace dos años tuvo un accidente y tiene problemas en la columna vertebral, es por eso que ahora se dedica a transportar materiales de construcción.

José, necesita el dinero para reparar su vehículo, ya que le está fallando y es su principal fuente de ingreso.

Lo que más desea, es que no le falte su trabajo pero tampoco su herramienta para poder trabajar.
texts.en:
Jose is 65 years old and studied until the seventh grade.  He has been living with his partner who is 35 years old, retired, and does not have any children.

Jose works as a mason, carrier and also works in metal structures. He has always worked in masonry, but two years ago he had an accident and has problems in his spine.  For this reason he now dedicates himself to transporting construction materials.

Jose needs the loan to repair his vehicle because it is failing and is his primary source of income.

What he desires most is to not miss work but also this tool which allows him to be able to work.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle because it is failing and is his main source of income.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 65 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Linda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to raise.

Linda has been raising livestock for eleven years and also earns income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 48 years old and has one child. Amalia is married and her child is in school.

Amalia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Amalia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Amalia has been raising livestock for 10 years, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Amalia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Xochilth

texts.es: XOCHILTH: Es una joven afable de 27 años de edad, casada con dos hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria.  Desde  hace 19 años habitan en una casa construida de madera y de tambo, que actualmente necesita reparación.  Es por eso que solicitan su primer préstamo para cambiar madera rústica y comprar: madera cepillada, postes de madera, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella y su marido sueñan con tener una casa de concreto que tenga mejores condiciones para sus hijos y sobre todo mayor seguridad
texts.en:
Xochilth is an amiable young woman, 27 years old, married, and the mother of two adolescent children who're in primary school. They've lived for nineteen years in a wooden stilt house which is currently in need of repair.

She's requesting her first loan to upgrade the basic wood. She will buy planed wood, wooden posts, nails, and also pay the cost of labor. 

She and her husband dream of having a home made of concrete to provide better and, above all, safer housing for the children.

loans.use: to replace the wood of her wooden stilt house.

loans.name: Canda Arely

texts.es:
Canda, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, estudió hasta quinto grado de educación básica, está felizmente acompañada, su pareja trabaja en una gasolinera a un 1 kilómetro de su casa, y tiene 4 hijos, pero en casa solo viven 2 pequeños, que aún van a la escuela.

Canda, desde hace ocho años se dedica a hacer pan, como ayudante de su cuñada, el pan lo salen a vender todas las tardes. 

El préstamo solicitado es para la construcción de un horno artesanal, motivada por su cuñada y el negocio ha decidido hacer pan de forma independiente, para obtener mejores ingresos, que le permitan gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.

Canda, sueña con llegar a tener una panadería fuerte, para ir aumentando sus ganancias y así darle una mejor calidad vida a sus hijos.- También, sueña con ver a sus hijos convertirse en  profesionales y que sean ejemplo para su comunidad.
texts.en:
Canda is 38 years old and a woman entrepreneur.  She studied up until 5th grade in primary school and is happily living together with her partner, who works in a gas station 1 km. away from their house.  She has 4 children, but only two of them live at home; two small children who still go to school.

Canda has earned her living making bread for the past 8 years working as a assistant to her sister-in-law.  They go out to sell bread every evening.  

The loan requested is to go towards building a traditional oven.  Motivated by her sister-in-law and the business, she's decided to make bread on her own to earn more income, which will allow her to enjoy a better quality of life.

Canda dreams of eventually having a strong, stable bakery to be able to supplement her earnings and provide a better quality of life for her children.  She also dreams of seeing her children get an education and become professionals, and hopes that they'll be an example for their community.

loans.use: build a traditional oven

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 55 years old and a married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Carmen has a food production business in the Philippines. Carmen requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and other spices for her food production business.

Carmen has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and other spices for her food production business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edna is 55 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Edna has a food vending business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, and seasonings for her food production business.

Edna has been in this business for four years. In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, and seasonings for her food production business

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 53 years old and a married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. For the past ten years, Clara has run a general store in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Clara is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries such as sugar, diapers, canned goods, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, diapers, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with six children, two of whom are currently in school. She is 43 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past ten years, Imelda has run a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Imelda is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets for her business

loans.name: Emee

texts.en:
Emee is a 41 years old and is married with three children. All of her children are in school. For the past three years, Emee has run an oyster farm in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Emee is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy new tools, bamboo, binders, and other equipment for her farm. In the future, she would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy tools, bamboo, binders and other equipment for her farm

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: Dopé est une femme veuve qui vit Klévé avec ses trois enfants. Dopé travaille  activement pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Dopé vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans une boutique afin d’avoir son bénéfice. Dopé achète ses provisions deux fois par mois sur un marché local du quartier et demande ce crédit pour commander des bidons d’huile et des sacs de riz
texts.en: Dopé is a widow living in Klévé with her three children. She works very hard for the well-being of her children. In order to meet her goals, Dopé makes a living by sells general food products in a store. She stock up twice a month at the neighborhood market and is seeking this loan in order to buy jugs of vegetable oil and bags of rice.

loans.use: to buy 25 jugs of oil and two bags of rice.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store and a pig fattening businesses. Nida is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional kitchen-ware and ingredients for her food business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchen-ware and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Paola Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Pequeños Comerciantes.
En este lugar vive la señora Paola, tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos de 12 y 3 años, el mayor estudia colegio. Su esposo es albañil. Ella hace tiempo aprendió belleza en una academia local.
Doña Paola  es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, ella realiza trabajos de belleza como tinturados,  pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja en su casa y también realiza trabajos a domicilio, ella al mismo tiempo que realiza sus trabajos también vende ropa por catalogo,  por lo general sus clientes a quienes les realiza sus trabajos siempre le compran una que otra prenda. Lleva más 1 año realizando esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo y que les ayuda mucho ya que su marido no gana mucho en su trabajo.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar ropa, tintes, esmaltes y herramientas que aun necesita. Lleva 2 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The members of the "Pequeños Comerciantes" communal bank meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, which has been known as the city of the Reales Tamarindos for many years. 

This is where Paola lives. She is 30 years old, in a common-law partnership, and she has two children from this relationship, who are ages three and twelve, the oldest attends school. Her husband works in construction. 

A while ago, she learned cosmetology at a local school. Paola is a hard-working woman who likes to help her husband with the household expenses and the education of her children. She works in cosmetology where she is dying hair and painting nails, among other things. She works in her home and she also does the household duties. While she works, she also sells clothing from a magazine. In general, her customers always buy one garment or another from her. She has been doing this work for over a year, earning a living which helps them a lot since her husband does not make a lot of money at his job. 

This loan will be used to buy clothing, hair dye, nail polish and tools that she still needs. This is her second season in the communal bank and she likes the help and the benefits she receives from them. Her dream is to have a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy clothing, hair dye, nail polish, and tools.

loans.name: Lesilda

texts.en:
Lesilda is a 39-year-old married woman with four children who are all in school. For the past five years, she has run a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lesilda is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Shiela Mae

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Shiela Mae works hard to support her family. She has a personal products business in the Philippines and also earns income from frozen food and motorcycle passenger businesses.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to replenish her stock of personal products to sell.

Shiela Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like body lotion, perfume, soap and other personal items to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 32-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. For the past five years, she has run a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Helen is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more assorted vegetables to sell in her food stall. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Odinakhon

texts.ru: Одинахон очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, она погасила свой кредит и решила взять новый. В ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1,15 Га земельной доли с теплицами, где выращиваются картофель и помидоры. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Одинахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян огурцов, помидоров, удобрений. Доходы от кредита Одинахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, постройку теплицы и свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Odinakhon is very grateful to the Kiva Fund and all of the investors. She repaid her loan and decided to request a new one. Today her farm contains 1.15 hectares of land with greenhouses, where she grows potatoes and tomatoes. Her monthly income amounts to up to 20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Odinakhon requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy cucumber and tomato seeds and fertilizers. Odinakhon plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business, building a greenhouse and her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy cucumber and tomato seeds and fertilizers in order to grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Unidos Somos Mas Group

texts.es:
ANA, con sus 55 años de edad, vive en un pueblo muy humilde en su pequeña casa con sus 9 hijos. desde hace mas de 15 años se dedica a la recolección de - cangrejos- cría de pollos- compra venta de chancho- y el cultivo de coco. En su hogar vende bebidas refrescantes. actividades que permiten apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, los mismos que deben trasladarse todos los días a Borbon para asistir a clases.
Ella con el crédito anterior, compró pollos pequeños, cerdos, para trabajar en el campo plantó varias palmas de coco que muy pronto darán producción.
ANA , es integrante de un grupo de 9 personas llamado "UNIDOS SOMOS MAS" Personas que luchan por mejorar el estilo y calidad de vida de los miembros de su familia.
Este es el segundo crédito que gestiona en visionfund y dice estar muy contenta de poder trabajar en su mejorado negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, 55 years old, lives in a small village in her small house with her nine children.  For more than 15 years she has dedicated herself to collecting crabs, breeding chickens, the purchase and sale of pigs, and the cultivation of coconut.  In her home she sells soft drinks.  Such activities allow her to support her children in their studies.  Her children must also be moved to Borbon every day to attend classes.

With the previous loan, Ana purchased small chickens and pigs and on the farm planted various coconut trees which will produce very soon.

She is a member of a group of nine people called "UNIDOS SOMOS MAS."  They are people who fight to improve their style and quality of life for themselves and for members of their families.

This is the second loan that she manages in visionfund and says she's very happy to be able to work in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase and sell pigs and chickens and to perform construction work of an irrigation ditch for coconut plants.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco padre de familia de 38 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de 3 hijos de las edades entre 5 y 11 años, viven en una comunidad de Suchitepequez.
Francisco es un padre de familia que para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su familia se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 15 años, Francisco con todos los años de experiencia que tiene, es muy buscado por las personas que desean construir su casa, pero él no se conforma con solo estos ingresos, es por ello que también cuenta con 25 cajas de colmenas que le producen mil, Francisco cuenta que esta segunda actividad para él es bastante rentable, pues en su comunidad casi ya no hay personas que se dediquen a la cría de colmenas; dado a las circunstancias en las que se encuentra  su casa, él ha tomado la decisión de remodelar su casa, pero con lo que el gana no le alcanza para comprar todo lo necesario para la remodelación es por eso que él solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, block, arena , balcones vidrios, para la remodelación de su casa.
El gran anhelo de Francisco es incrementar su negocio de colmenas, para mejorar sus ingresos y apoyar a sus hijos en la escuela.
texts.en:
Francisco, a 38-year old father, is married and has a lovely family of 3 children between 5 and 11 years of age. The live in a community of Suchitepequez.

Francisco is a father who, in order to earn income and support his family, has made his living in construction for the past 15 years. But he is not satisfied with just these earnings. That is why he also has 25 beehives that produce honey. Francisco says that this second business is quite profitable for him, because in his community, there is no one who has beehives.

Given the condition of his house, he has decided to remodel it, but what he earns is not sufficient to buy everything he needs for the remodeling. That is why he is applying for a loan that he will use to buy cement, cinder blocks, sand, security bars, and glass to remodel his house.

Francisco's great desire is to grow his beehive business, in order to increase his earnings and support his children in school.

loans.use: to purchase cement, cinder blocks, sand, security bars, and glass for remodeling his house.

loans.name: Bibiniso

texts.ru: Бибинисо 34 лет. Она замужем и мать четверых детей. Она проживает в городе Куляб вместе мамой и семьей. У нее трое дочери и один сын. Дочкам 12, 9 и 7 лет. Сыну 11 лет. Дети ходят в школу. Ее мама пенсионерка, она дома  ухаживает о детьми. Бибинисо начала заниматься шитьем женской одежды на дому 2008 году. У нее есть свои клиенты. В швейном деле ей нравится ежедневный доход, и это деятельность является основной источником дохода. Бибинисо хочет расширить деятельность и улучшить жилищные условия семьи. Она очень хочет улучшить жилищные условия жизни семьи и расширить свою деятельность. Поэтому Бибинисо запрашивает кредит. За счет кредита она купить больше ткани и строй материалы. Она верит в Вас и знает, что Вы поможете ей с финансовыми трудностями. Поддержите Бибинисо.
texts.en: Bibiniso is 34 years old, married and a mother of four children. She lives in the town of Kulob together with her mother and family. She has three daughters and one son. Her daughters are 12, 9 and 7 years old. Her son is 11 years old. All of her children go to school. Her mother is retired and looks after the children at home. Bibiniso got involved in sewing women's clothing at home in 2008. She has regular customers. She likes the daily income in the sewing business, which serves as her primary income source. Bibiniso really wants to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. This is why Bibiniso is requesting this loan. She will use the loan to buy more fabrics and construction materials. She believes in You and knows that You will help her with her financial difficulties. Please support Bibiniso.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and construction materials to repair her house

loans.name: Yodgoroy

texts.ru: Ёдгорой молодая жительница района Бохтар. Ей всего 25 лет. Она замужем и мать одного ребенка. Она живет с мамой, мужем и ребенком. Ёдгорой занимается шитьем женской одежды у себя дома. В швейном деле она занята уже 4 года. Она хорошо знает свою работу. Ёдгорой активная женщина. Она зарабатывает и помогает мужу обеспечить семьи. Ее муж водитель такси. Его доходы от этой деятельности. У него есть свои клиенты. Она работает днем и ночь, чтобы прокормить свою семью. Ему нужно отремонтировать свой автомобиль. Из-за нехватки денежных средств Ёдгорой обратилась за кредитом для восстановления машины мужа.
texts.en: Yodgoroy is a young resident of the Bohtar district. She is only 25 years old. She is married and a mother of one child. She lives with her mother, husband and child. Yodgoroy is involved in sewing women's clothing at home. She has been in this business for 4 years and knows her work well. Yodgoroy is an active woman. She earns money and helps her husband to provide for the family. Her husband is a taxi driver and earns an income from this business. He has regular customers. He works day and night to provide for the family and now needs to repair his car. Due to a monetary shortage, Yodgoroy requested this loan to help repair her husband's car.

loans.use: to repair her husband's car

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is married and works hard to support her family. She does business buying and selling herbal products in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to replenish her stock of herbal products to sell.

Maribel has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more herbal products to sell

loans.name: Dolor

texts.en:
Dolor is a 46-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Dolor has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maricel works hard to support her family. She does business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending.

Maricel is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers through her business.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 31 years old and married. She has two children, who are both in school.

Marilou is in the agricultural business, raising goats in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her goats.

Marilou has been raising goats for three years now, and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain her business. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her goats

loans.name: Ever Mauricio

texts.es:
Ever, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado desde hace 15 años, tiene dos hijos y su señora se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace seis años.

Ever, trabaja como empleado en una alcaldía, en el área de limpieza de calles, consiguió el trabajo por medio de su padrastro.

Ever, necesita el dinero para comprar madera, lámina y pagar la mano de obra para arreglar su vivienda, porque está dañada y ya se acerca el invierno y teme que su familia se moje.

El sueño de Ever, es ver cuando sus hijos se gradúen de la universidad, pues él tuvo muchas barreras para poder estudiar y no quiere que sus hijos pasen por lo mismo, por eso quiere que sean profesionales exitosos.
texts.en:
Ever is 34 years old and studied until the fourth grade.  He has been in a relationship for 15 years, has two children and his partner has worked in a clothing store for six years.

Ever works as a township employee in the area of street cleaning.  He obtained this job through his stepfather.

Ever needs a loan to purchase wood, sheet plate and to pay for labor to fix his home because it is damaged and winter is approaching.  He fears his family will get wet.

Ever's dream is to see his children graduate from the university.  He had many barriers preventing him from studying and he does not want his children to go through the same thing.  For this reason he wants them to be successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase wood, sheet plates and to pay for labor to fix his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment for her cake-making business

loans.name: Isabel Antonio

texts.es: Isabel tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida. Él es un hombre trabajador quien se dedica al cultivo de la tierra desde hace mucho tiempo. Es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y junto a su esposa quien se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos mantienen la economía del  hogar. Isabel desea mejorar las condiciones del piso de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en: Isabel is 29 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner.  He is a hardworking man who dedicates himself to the cultivation of land for many years.  It's through this work that he's able to sustain his home and with his partner who is dedicated to the provision of domestic services. This is how they maintain the economy of the home.  Isabel desires to improve the conditions of the floor of his home.  For this reason he requests a FUSAI loan to invert in the purchase of cement, sand and gravel for setting in concrete floor of his home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and gravel for setting in concrete floor of the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, galvanized sheets, and wood for making home repairs.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina wants to take a loan of PHP 15,000 to renew a motorcycle license and franchise. Josefina’s husband operates their motorcycle for a passenger transportation service. Their daily income from their motorcycle is used to meet their daily food needs with their two children. 

Josefina wants to renew their motorcycle registration and renew their franchise for continuous operation of their motorcycle. It will be a big help for her family to have this source of income in able to fulfill their children's needs and be able to send them to school until college.

loans.use: to renew the motorcycle license and franchise.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rosana works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from fruit vending. Rosana is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Rosana has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Erlinda has been in this business for eight years.

Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who does business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ready-to-wear items like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

Norma has been in this business for two years. In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ready-to-wear items like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell through her business.

Delia has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Delia's dream is to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria Myrna

texts.en:
Maria Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her business.

Maria Myrna successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Maria Myrna's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 41 years old, married, and has four children. With three children currently in school, Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, cereals, and coffee. 

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 43 years old and married with three children, who are all in school.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rosalie aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Wilma has been in this business for two years now.

Wilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, fish and vegetables for her food production business.

Wilma has been in this business for 23 years.

Wilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, fish and vegetables for her food production business

loans.name: Wilyn

texts.en:
Wilyn is 42 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Wilyn has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock.

Wilyn has been raising livestock for 3 years and has previously borrowed 6 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Wilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Alma works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Alma is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy, 46 years old, is married and has five children, two of them currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 14 years, Mercy has operated a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand. In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda works hard to support her family. Reynalda is married woman with two children and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Reynalda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour and oil for her food production business.

Reynalda has been in this business for five years, and she also earns income from direct sales of Personal Collection goods.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour and oil for her food production business

loans.name: Lautasi

texts.en: Lautasi is a 38-year-old widow with 1 child. She has a small plantation where she has been growing kava plants for 3 years. Lautasi has requested a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, weed spray, a wheelbarrow, etc. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services. Lautasi hopes to use her profits to improve her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, chemicals, weed spray, a wheelbarrow, etc.

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela is 30 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Rasela has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, oil, yeast, a frying pan and other items needed for her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital.

Rasela will use her earnings to improve her business and to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, yeast, a frying pan and other inputs for her pancake business

loans.name: Neti

texts.en:
Neti is 23 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily consumption items such as sugar, rice, flour and snacks. She has been doing this for three years. 

Neti needs a loan to buy a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, a box of chicken, a box of snacks, a freezer and other items for her business. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and support her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, a bag of flour, a freezer and other needed items

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 14 years, she has operated a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. Lydia has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell to her customers. Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen works hard to support her family and has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Queen has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her manicure/pedicure service business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 51 years old and married with four children. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines, where she fattens pigs.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

Norma has been running her pig-fattening business for four years now and has borrowed from NWTF nine times in the past to sustain it. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 46 years old and married with three children. For the past eight years she has worked hard running a sari sari, or general store in the Philippines. She also earns extra income from raising and selling pigs.

Tessie has borrowed and paid off two loans from NWTF before this. She has now applied for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional groceries for her shop like soft drinks, beer, canned goods, candy, biscuits, detergent, soap, etc. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari sari

loans.name: Massalou

texts.fr: Massalou vit à Agoè et est âgée de 44 ans. Veuve, Massalou est  mère de quatre enfants et très active pour favoriser leur éducation. Massalou vend des céréales  dans son quartier pour avoir son revenu pour leur subsistance. Massalou s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de maïs, Massalou demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire.
texts.en:
Massalou lives in Agoè and is 44 years old. A widow, Massalou is the mother of four children and works hard to further their education.  Massalou sells cereals in her neighborhood so as to earn enough for their subsistence. 

Massalou buys her supplies four times a month in the market. So as to order some sacks of maize, Massalou is requesting this loan to complete her purchase and earn the necessary profit.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of maize

loans.name: Sandy Johanna

texts.es:
Sandy, de 22 años de edad, está soltera y vive junto con su madre, su padrastro y un hermano menor, nadie depende económicamente de ella.

Sandy, desde los 4 años de edad le gusta acompañar a su madre al mercado, se ha dedicado a varios negocios como la venta de frutas y verduras, pero desde hace cuatro años se dedican al comercio de ropa, pues les resulta más rentable, también vende pan y café en las horas de la tarde en el mismo mercado. 

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar ropa, porque quiere empezar a generar sus propios ingresos, para independizarse totalmente y estar preparada para formar un hogar.

Sandy, sueña con llegar a tener una tienda fuerte de ropa en el centro de la ciudad, que le permita gozar de una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su futura familia.
texts.en:
Sandy is 22 years old, single, and lives with her mother, her stepfather, and a younger brother. No one is financially dependent on her. 

Since she was 4 years old, Sandy liked to accompany her mother to the market. She was involved in various businesses such as selling fruit and vegetables, but for the past 4 years they have been selling clothing because it is more profitable. She also sells bread and coffee at the same market during the afternoon. 

The requested loan is to buy clothing, because she wants to begin to generate her own income, become completely independent, and be ready to start her own household. Sandy dreams of eventually having a real clothing store in the city center which will allow her and her future family to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Roukeya

texts.fr: Roukeya vit à Agoè et est âgée de 56 ans. Mariée, Roukeya est mère de cinq enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Roukeya vend de la bouillie et de la farine de blé dans son quartier pour avoir son revenu pour leur subsistance. Roukeya s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de farine de blé et du sucre pour préparer la bouillie, Roukeya demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire.
texts.en:
Roukeya lives in Agoè and is 56 years of age. Married, Roukeya is the mother of five children and works hard to further their education. Roukeya sells porridge made of wheat flour in her neighborhood to earn income for their subsistence. She buys her supplies four times a month at the market. 

So as to order some sacks of flour and sugar to make the porridge, Roukeya is requesting this loan to complete her purchase and earn the necessary profit.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of wheat flour and three sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Malika Shehraz

texts.en:
Malika Shehraz is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall. He sells different types of eatable items such as samosa, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, kofta Kabab paratha, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Malika's husband needs to purchase different types of eatables and other items for his business purpose so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase these items for his business purpose. Therefore, Malika has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's food stall business

loans.name: Tuulima

texts.en: Tuulima is 56 years old and married with eight children. She runs a small business selling banana chips in her community and has been doing this for three years. Tuulima has requested a loan to buy cooking oil, a frying pan, bananas, plastic papers, containers etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tuulima will use her profit to extend her business and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy oil, a frying pan, paper, bananas, etc

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en:
Aiga is 56, married and has six children. For the past nine years she has sewn and sold clothes in her community.

Aiga joined SPBD this year to gain access to its financial services. She has applied for a 1,000 WST loan to buy a sewing machine, fabric, needles, thread, scissors, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric, needles, thread, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting and timber to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Greg is 22 years old and is the third of six children in the family. His mother Helen, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Greg is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in criminology. He is currently in the fourth of this four-year course.

Helen is borrowing PHP 7,500 to pay the tuition fees of her son Greg for the second semester of the school year of 2014-2015.

Greg plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Begilia

texts.en:
Begilia is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Begilia is 57 years old, and five of her children are currently in school.

Begilia has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Begilia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Begilia has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Begilia would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 47 years old and married with six children. She has been raising cattle in the Philippines for 28 years and earns additional income from fishing.

Gina is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Bushra is also providing sewing services and earning an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods, like needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above-mentioned accessories and will also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Bushra is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase sewing accessories for her tailoring business

loans.name: Leida Isabel

texts.es: LEIDA ISABEL: Es una mujer simpática de 32 años de edad, originaria de Waspam Rio Coco, pertenece a la etnia miskita. Madre soltera de un hijo de 11 años de edad que estudia su primer año de secundaria. Tiene una casa semi-construida pero le falta el zinc y madera para el techo; con su salario no le ajusta para poder comprarlo, por eso está solicitando su primer préstamo con Pana Pana para poder completar su casa y trasladarse con su familia. Ella sueña con tener una vivienda de concreto, que es de mayor durabilidad y brindarle a su hijo un hogar con las mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
LEIDA ISABEL is a kind woman who is 32 years old. She is from Waspam Rio Coco and is of Miskito ethnicity. She is the single mother of an 11-year-old son who is in his first year of secondary school. 

Their house is only half finished, and they still need the corrugated metal and wood for the roof. She doesn't make enough money to buy these things, and for this reason she is asking for her first loan with Pana Pana. She will then be able to finish her house and move in with her family.

Leida dreams of having a house build of concrete which is more durable and would provide her son with better living conditions.

loans.use: to finish building her wooden stilt-house.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 44 years old, married and has one child. For the past ten years she has been raising pigs in the Philippines.

Arlene has successfully borrowed and repaid loans from NWTF nine times for her pig business. She has requested a 10,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is saving money to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nargis Bibi

texts.en:
Nargis Bibi is a 42-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been running a butcher shop for the past twenty years. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family.

Nargis Bibi's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g. butcher and other consumer items for his business. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes.

Therefore, Nargis Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and will also enable him to increase profits and manage his household and business.

Nargis Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's business.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 23 ans, Akouvi est une femme qui vit à Ségbé avec ses deux enfants. Au marché, Akouvi vend du charbon de bois et des arachides emballés  à ses clients et trouve son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Akouvi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Akouvi demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs charbons de bois et réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes de la famille
texts.en:
Married and 23 years old, Akouvi is a woman who lives in Ségbé with her two children. At the market, Akouvi sells charcoal and packages of peanuts to her customers and earns her income thanks to this business. To respond effectively to her needs, Akouvi stocks up three times a month from her suppliers. 

Akouvi is requesting this loan to order some sacks of charcoal and make even more income, so that she can help her husband to cover the daily expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Saifunae

texts.en: Saifunae is 55 years old and married with eight children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. Saifunae has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, a bag of sugar, oil, baking powder, plastic papers, etc. She joined SPBD in this year 2015 to gain access to financial services. With her earnings, Saifunae will improve her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, a bag of sugar, baking powder, plastic papers etc

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Rio Negro Group

texts.es:
Rosa de 62 años soltera, con hijos independientes. Hace 3 años decide abrir su propio negocio (restaurant) en su propio domicilio y paralelo a ello los fines de semana vende comidas y bebidas típicas de la selva. El sueño de Rosa es implementar su negocio y así poder tener más clientela. Solicito el préstamo para comprar insumos (arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosa)para la preparación de sus comidas. Rosa viste polo de color verde.
Está muy contenta de haber recibido el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva.
texts.en:
Rosa is 62 years old, she is single, and has adult children. 3 years ago she decided to open her own business (a restaurant) in her own home, and she also sells food and typical jungle drinks on the weekends. Rosa's dream is to establish her own business, to be able to have more customers. 

She requested the loan to buy consumable goods such as rice, sugar, oil, soda, to prepare her food.

Rosa is wearing a green shirt. She is very happy to have received the support from the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy consumable goods such as rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
Muslima is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1975. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a master of repairing houses. She is living in a rural area. 

She has nine years’ experience of being a chairwoman. Her work is hard but it is how she tries to earn some money for a living. 

Becoming older, she is tired of doing hard work. She wants to get identification documents for herself and find a new job and place of work. She is chairwoman at a hospital now. She needs financial support to prepare her documents.

loans.use: To get identification documents for herself

loans.name: Beknazar

texts.en:
Beknazar is a composed man. He was born in 1975. He is living in a remote district. He is married and has two children.

He is a constructor and has been working for about eight years. He is a very capable, honest, and creative person. He does his work very well. He has a lot of satisfied customers. He is well known among constructors.

He needs to buy a ticket to Russia for his brother because his brother does not have enough money to buy the ticket, but it is necessary for him to fly to Russia for finding job. Beknazar is requesting financial support for buying a ticket to Russia for his brother.

loans.use: to buy a ticket for his brother to fly to Russia.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Patricia has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income her general store.

Patricia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 45 years old and married with five children. For the past fourteen years she has worked running a sari sari, or general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Wilma has successfully borrowed and paid off 23 prior loans from NWTF. She is now applying for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries to sell in her shop. She is working hard to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jenelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Benia

texts.en:
Benia is 57 years old and married with nine children. One of her children is still in school.

Benia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for 12 years now.

Benia requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Benia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her variety store.  Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en: Lusia is 45 years old with six children. She operates a business selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Lusia has requested a loan to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2005 and hopes to use her profit to expand her business, as well as to provide family needs.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Aga

texts.en:
Aga is a 36 year old woman who is single with 2 children.

She runs a business sewing and selling puletasi (traditional Samoan dresses) and t-shirts in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Aga has requested a loan to buy threads, scissors, a sewing machine, materials etc.

She plans to use her profits to extend her house. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy scissors, thread, a sewing machine, materials etc for her puletasi and t-shirt business.

loans.name: Faanee

texts.en:
Faanee is 52 years old and a widow woman with 6 children. She runs a small business selling chips and pork buns in her community and has been doing this for 2 years.

Faanee has requested a loan to buy frying pans, cooking oil, sacks of flour, boxes of chicken, soy sauce, containers, etc.. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital.

With her earnings, Faanee hopes to improve her business income and save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy frying pans, cooking oil, sacks of flour, boxes of chicken, etc.

loans.name: Iseaso

texts.en: Iseaso, 44 years old, is married and has 5 children. For the past 5 years, she has operated a small business of a taxi stand and bingo. Iseaso needs a loan to buy car tires, a taxi sign, engine oil, fuel, seat covers,  etc. She will use her profits to start a new business as a car dealer. Iseaso joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy car tires, a taxi sign, engine oil, fuel, etc.

loans.name: Mainifo

texts.en:
Mainifo is 26 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily items such as sugar, salt, chicken, snacks, soft drinks, etc. She has been doing this for five years. 

Mainifo needs a loan to buy a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, soft drinks, snacks, chicken, etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and support her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, soft drinks, snacks, chicken, etc

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is married and has a daughter. Ivan owns a business. Ivan has been growing flowers in greenhouses for 7 years. All his family members are engaged in this business. Ivan has three greenhouses.In future he plans to build one more greenhouse. He is a hard working, active man.  To provide for his family Ivan has an additional part-time job at the factory. Ivan is asking for a loan of 35 000 UAH to buy heating supplies (wood), soil and fertilizers to grow flowers. Ivan hopes to receive additional income and take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy heating supplies (wood), soil and fertilizers to grow flowers

loans.name: Mohinur

texts.en:
Mohinur is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1969 at a family of farmers. Her parents died when she was a child. She grew up in bad conditions in an orphanage. She could not feel the warmness and cherish of being a child. She became an adult and left the orphanage. 

Mohinur was transferred to a village by government. She got married there. Now she has two children. Her half life has passed doing hard work. She individually opened a farming business in a small town. Mohinur is gaining profitable income from this activity. 

She is planning to make new sowing. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is an industrious woman from North Tajikistan. She is widowed and has six children. She has experienced a lot of difficulties in her life as she has raised her children alone. 

Jamila works hard. Her working day usually begins early in the morning. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 12 years. She feeds cows at her house, where she has a big cowshed. Jamila now feeds four cows. She feeds milk cows and sells milk cows to local people. 

Jamila is going to organize a wedding party for her daughter, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to organize her daughter's wedding party. She awaits your support and your mercy.

loans.use: to organize her daughter's wedding party.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her ornamental business. Her earnings from her farm helps support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would now like to apply for another 25,000 loan which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs (seedlings), pots, wires and net she needs for growing her ornaments to sell. It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her.

Shirley dreams that her ornamental farm business will grow and flourish. She aims to improve her family's quality of life, and for her children to pursue a college degree. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and farm inputs for their flower farm.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 48 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school.

Celia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Celia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Celia has been raising pigs for six years.

In the future, Celia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Evangeline requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing nets, fish containers, etc. for her business.

Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing nets, fish containers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Wilma is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 38 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicine, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Luzviminda has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicine, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 50 years old and married with two children.

Riza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Riza has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 36 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Riza aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 39 years old and has one child. She is married and her child is in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalie has been in pig fattening for seven years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Rosalie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is a married woman with three children. She is 49 years old and two of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Susie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Susie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna, a 62-year-old married mother of eight, has been  raising pigs in the Philippines for nine years now. Having repaid her 13 previous loans from NWTF, she has requested a new one for PHP 23000 to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Nesie

texts.en:
Ma. Nesie is 49 years old and married with six children.

Ma. Nesie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, spices, coffee, bread, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Ma. Nesie has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 24 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Ma. Nesie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, spices, coffee, bread, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Jose Walter

texts.es: Don José, es un apasionado por la tecnología y sus avances, por lo que se desempeña como técnico en reparaciones eléctricas. Él está casado y es padre de seis hijos pero solamente tiene dos a su cargo.
