Don José ha logrado salir adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación, esta vez para aumentar su inventario solicita un crédito ya que desea comprar más piezas  de repuestos, lo cual, le permitirá tener más ingresos, más clientela y mantener un capital siempre para trabajar.
texts.en:
José is passionate about technology and its advances. For this reason, he makes a living as an electrical repairs technician.

He is married and is the father of six children, but only two of them are his dependants.

José has been able to get ahead with a great deal of effort and dedication. 

This time, he is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts to increase his inventory. This purchase will allow him to have more income and more customers, and to always have working capital set aside to follow his occupation.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Shehnaz Bibi

texts.en:
Shehnaz bibi is a 35-year-old mother of one son and three daughters, all of whom attend school. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, where her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for six years. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Shehnaz bibi's husband needs to purchase a variety types of clothes in bulk to resell, so she is requesting a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this purpose. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Shehnaz bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand her husband's clothing-sales business

loans.name: Sarwar Bibi

texts.en:
Sarwar Bibi is a 29-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and four daughters. Her children are studying. Her husband has been running her own business selling clothes for seven years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Sarwar Bibi is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Sarwar Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes in bulk for her husband's business

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally is 49 years old, a married farmer, and has an only child living in the Takeo province in Cambodia. 

She has cultivated rice and fattened animals since 1990. 

Her husband (shown in the photo) is a 49-year-old construction worker, and her child works in a factory.  The family can make around 16 USD daily. 

Phally is applying for a loan and she will use it to buy construction materials to renovate her house. With the loan, she will have enough money to renovate the house. 

For her future plans, she wants her husband to be a construction foreman and build fences around her house. In addition to the renovation, she also wants to buy chickens to fatten.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Fuataina

texts.en:
For more than a year Fuataina, a 26-year-old mother of two, has been operating a small business selling ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She  has requested a loan to buy sugar, plastic bags, an ice bag, cooler and container to help her run the business. 

Fuataina  became a member of SPBD in 2015. She hopes to use her profit to expand her enterprise in the near future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, plastic bags, an ice bag, cooler and container

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: Tamara is a 60-year-old mother with 5 children. She runs a cattle farm business in the village. Tamara has requested a loan to buy a water tank, a backpack sprayer and chemicals, and to pay for her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2005. Tamara hopes to expand her business in the near future using her profit and to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a water tank, a backpack sprayer and chemicals, and to pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Asiasiga

texts.en: Asiasiga, 57 years old, is married and has 4 children. For the past 4 years, she has run a business selling lavalava (a traditional Polynesian cloth worn as a skirt by men and women), puletasi (a traditional two-piece dress) and t-shirts in her community. Asiasiga has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, material, thread, scissors, etc. She plans to use her profits to support good education for her children. Asiasiga joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, material, thread, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Faasulu

texts.en: Faasulu, 33 years old, has 5 children. For more than a year, she has operated a business selling banana and taro in her community. Faasulu has requested a loan to buy banana and taro seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals and a backpack sprayer to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2011, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana and taro seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, chemicals and a backpack sprayer

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Melba works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending.

Melba is borrowing PHP 4000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her vegetable vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF.

Melba hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Porcelie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Porcelie works hard to support her family. She has a fishing / fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Porcelie successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to buy additional materials and equipment for her business. 

Porcelie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and equipment for her business

loans.name: Ma. Guadalupe

texts.en:
Ma. Guadalupe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Ma. Guadalupe requested a PHP 24,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials such as fabric, threads, needles, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for 18 years now.

Ma. Guadalupe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials such as fabric, thread, needles, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Melinda works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Melinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 45 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are in school. Elena has been raising pigs in the Philippines for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Ausetalia

texts.en: Ausetalia is 23 years old, For more than a year, she has owned and operated a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community. Ausetalia has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour and sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons and a fry pan to assist her to run the business. Ausetalia hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour and sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons and a fry pan

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, a 25-year-old mother mother of two, has been running a small business selling taro and banana chips in her community for more than a year to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, a fry pan, wooden spoon, container and plastic bags to assist her with the business. 

Esther joined SPBD in 2015. She will use her profits to expand her enterprise and provide her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon,  container and plastic bags

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 59 years old. She is a widower and manages a stall selling dry goods such as blouses, slippers, and pants. She had been in her business for over ten years. She manages it well to gain income for the family.

She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 30,000 to increase her merchandise. She will buy t-shirts, blouses, pants, and slippers to sell.

This will help improve sales capacity, especially since she has many competitors in the said business. She will extend good products and friendly service to acquire better profits.

loans.use: to buy more t-shirts, blouses, pants, and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
Farogat is a generous, kind, merciful, responsible, hardworking woman.  She was born in 1965, is married, and has one child. She lives in a small town.  

Her husband is a master in a Production Company. 

She has experience keeping livestock, and selling to stores and restaurants for about two years. 

For two years, she has been attracting permanent clients. She wants to get a loan to increase her business. Her daughter-in-law is helping her with the business. 

She likes to do business in this sphere, because her husband taught her. 

Farogat is planning to buy products for her store, as well as cattle. 

She is asking for financial support from KIVA project to widen her business.

loans.use: to buy products for her store including cattle

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Theresa is 26 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Maria Theresa has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Maria Theresa has been in this business for one year. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion works hard to support her family. Salvacion is married and has a furniture manufacturing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 34 years now.

Salvacion requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase wood and other materials for her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase wood and other materials for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Gemma is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda, 60 years old, is married and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 5 years, Yolanda has operated a variety store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as shampoo, sardines, sugar and other groceries. In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as shampoo, sardines, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en: Minda is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 6 years, Minda has operated a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear. Minda has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion is 55 years old and married with three children. For the past 5 years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Salvacion also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a 25-year-old mother of two children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Imelda has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a fry pan to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to build small bakery store in the near future. Imelda  joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, and a fry pan

loans.name: Elieta

texts.en: Elieta is a 32-year-old mother of three children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei (fabric) printing materials at the market to earn a living. Elieta has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine,to help her run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. Elieta hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is aged 30, married to a farmer, and they're blessed with one child. 

She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost one year and she earns a net income of PHP 700 daily. 

Due to insufficient capital for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase fish, canned goods, noodles, breads, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase fish, canned goods, noodles, breads, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 63 years old, married with eight children and is a resident of Balasdiot, Baliangao, Philippines. She has been in the vegetable vending business for more than a decade as her primary source of income. She became a member of Paglaum MPC in June 2011. Recently, Teresita decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer for vegetables and to expand her business with flower vending. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell. In the future, she hopes to save more for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for flowers and vegetables

loans.name: Ma. Nelia

texts.en:
Ma. Nelia is 55 years old and a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Nelia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Ma. Nelia has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Ma. Nelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en: Katherine, 30 years old, is married and has one child, who is still in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 5 years, Katherine has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, spices, coffee, bread, milk, sugar, eggs, etc. to sell. Katherine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, spices, coffee, bread, milk, sugar, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Eri

texts.en:
Eri is a twenty-three-year old married man with one child living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy more sugar and soap to sell. 

He still operates a retail business of general merchandise, a salon, and a cocoa garden for supplementary income. He works very hard and he has great hopes of finishing his house.

He wants a loan to buy more merchandise, such as salt and cooking oil, among other items.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for sale.
